Well done, guys! We wish you the same perseverance and determination in any endeavor, as well as good health and success!

event: Students Write Letters to Military Personnel
description: Students from the Russian Embassy school in the United States wrote and sent letters to military personnel in the Special Operations zone, expressing gratitude and wishing them strength, courage, and bravery. The students, including Georgy and Varvara, hoped for the soldiers' swift return home with victory.
original:
Students from the school at the Russian Embassy in the United States wrote and sent letters to military personnel performing tasks in the Special Operations zone. “I wished the soldier to return home as soon as possible. I want to be as brave and brave as him,” said fifth-grade student Georgy.

And Varvara from the third grade, despite her young age, thinks just like an adult: “I wrote in my letter that they would return home as soon as possible. I wished them strength, courage, bravery. We believe that our soldiers will win.”

The school students are explained what Russian military personnel are doing in the Special Operations zone, and the children have the opportunity to convey their words of gratitude in letters, as well as wish our soldiers to return home with victory.
/Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation/@brd_nash

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze drone in the Novoazovsky region. The drone was carrying a 7kg warhead, intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The coordinated effort prevented a large-scale terrorist attack with potential casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

Against the backdrop of a major defeat of the Ukrainian armed forces in Avdiivka, the Kiev regime is making any attempts to destabilize the situation in the Republic. But thanks to the coordinated work of our special services, we were able to prevent a large-scale terrorist attack with casualties.

description: A video claiming to be a Ministry of Defense campaign to recruit women into the army was debunked as fake. The video was found to be compiled from arbitrary frames taken from other users' videos on social networks. The Ministry of Defense does not have a TikTok account, and no such recruitment campaign exists.
original:
📹 The Internet is spreading information that the Ministry of Defense has launched a campaign to recruit women into the army. 🗣 "Service in the Armed Forces helped me lose weight. Contact the nearest TCC. You deserve to be the best!" - goes on in such a video, and the video itself is allegedly published on the tiktok account of the Ministry of Defense.

This is a lie. VoxCheck specialists analyzed the case and came to the conclusion that the video is fake and compiled from arbitrary frames that the fake authors took from other people's videos of social network users.

Moreover, the video itself in no way serves as a video campaign for recruiting women to the army. 1️⃣First of all, the Ministry of Defense does not have a TikTok account. In other social networks of the ministry, no videos about weight loss were found either. 2️⃣Secondly, there is no general mobilization of women to the army in Ukraine, and therefore the "promorolyk" was invented by Kremlin henchmen. DM

event: Meeting between Russian Deputy Prime Minister and Ataman of All-Russian Cossack Society
description: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Chernyshenko met with Vitaly Kuznetsov, ataman of the All-Russian Cossack Society, to discuss plans for the current year and promising areas of work. They emphasized the importance of Cossack societies in promoting patriotism and supporting the state.
original:
Russian Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Chernyshenko met with the ataman of the All-Russian Cossack Society Vitaly Kuznetsov, the Government website reports.

They discussed the plans of the All-Russian Cossack Society for the current year, as well as promising areas of work. “For many centuries, the Russian Cossacks have stood for the protection of the interests of our Motherland, including participation in the Northern Military District. The Cossacks show by personal example to schoolchildren and students what patriotism and true love for Fatherland. I am sure that it is necessary to create and develop mechanisms that will stimulate the interest of the younger generation in joining Cossack societies," said Dmitry Chernyshenko. Vitaly Kuznetsov named the participation of Cossacks in the Special Operation, support for the families of SVO participants, and work as the main tasks for the All-Russian Cossack Society with youth, patriotic and spiritual and moral education.

The Cossack troops have confirmed in action that they are the support of our state, emphasized the ataman of VsKO. Be with us - First Cossack

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was allegedly found dead in Villajoyosa, Spain. Ukrainian intelligence confirmed his death, stating that he was shot and a burnt car was found nearby, possibly used by the killers to escape.
original:
Russian media are disseminating information that Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was allegedly found dead in the city of Villajoyos (Spain). They refer to the Italian newspaper IL-corrispondente, which in turn names the local Spanish publication ABC as the source of information. It states that the body of a shot 33-year-old Ukrainian was found in an underground parking lot - the investigation is working on a version of “settling scores.” The age of the deceased and Kuzminov’s age do not match; he was 28 years old. In addition, he had Russian citizenship.

It is necessary to wait for official information from the Spanish police regarding the identification of the deceased and the cause of death.❗️The GUR confirmed the death of Kuzminov “We can confirm the fact of death,” said GUR representative Andrey Yusov in a comment to Suspilny.❗️❗️UPD: A source in the GUR told Ukrainian Pravda that on the eve of his death, Kuzminov invited his ex-girlfriend to his place. “He decided to move to Spain instead of being here. From what we know: he invited his ex to his place and was found shot dead,” the publication quotes.

Also, according to Ukrainian intelligence, a burnt car was found nearby, in which the killers could have escaped.

Earlier, GRU officers in a story on the Russia 1 TV channel stated that they had received an order to eliminate the commander of the Russian helicopter, Maxim Kuzminov, who flew to Ukraine.📷From the archiveSubscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

event: Fraud on Tourists at New Athos Monastery
description: The New Athos Monastery in Abkhazia, a major Orthodox shrine and tourist attraction, has been seized by bandits who are using it as a front to defraud tourists. The Russian Orthodox Church has banned pilgrimages to the monastery and advises against making donations.
original:
Fraud on tourists in Abkhazia. Cash desk of the New Athos Monastery.

As usually happens, as soon as a problem is voiced, the dam of information simply breaks. The New Athos Monastery was founded at the end of the 19th century at the foot of Mount Athos by Russian monks with the participation of the Russian Emperor Alexander III. Nowadays, it has also been thoroughly restored at the expense of Russian money. This is one of the most important Orthodox shrines and tourist attractions in Abkhazia. New Athos is a very visited and, as a result, very profitable place. In 2011, a so-called church schism occurred in Abkhazia. The young generation of the Abkhaz clergy created the “Holy Metropolis of Abkhazia” and settled in the New Athos Monastery. This is how it is presented officially.

In fact, when in 2011 the Russian Orthodox Church appointed its representative to New Athos, by the way an Abkhazian by nationality, to restore order, he was almost killed, in the literal sense. They warned that the gang had already left, and he managed to escape. Now he is a very famous schema-abbot in Russia. Anyone in the know knows.

The Russian Orthodox Church has banned pilgrimages to this monastery and advises tourists not to make donations when visiting.

The New Athos Monastery is a temple cynically seized from the Russian Orthodox Church by bandits. Which has now become a screen for taking money from tourists.

I was there several years ago. A truly majestic temple, a place of amazing beauty and power. Only I didn’t know what really lay behind all this. This required a statement from the Russian Foreign Ministry and rampant crime in Abkhazia.

Dixi.

event: Refutation of Fake News on Real Estate
description: Russia has guaranteed property rights to citizens in new regions, allowing them to register their rights using pre-adoption documents. Ukrainian propaganda, including Ivan Fedorov, has spread false information about real estate in these regions, including claims of 're-registration', 'removal of valuable property', and 'nationalization'.
original:
Forwarded from: War on fakes
Fake: Russia is taking away real estate from Ukrainians in new regions. Property is entered into the Russian register at lightning speed, preventing previous owners from providing documents, writes the head of the Zaporozhye region’s Higher Administration Ivan Fedorov. Truth: Russia has provided all citizens of the new regions with guarantees in the field of property relations from the day they were accepted into its composition. Fedorov again distorts facts and substitutes concepts in order to discredit the actions of the Russian authorities.

You can register the right to real estate using documents issued before the day of the adoption of new regions in the Russian Federation. In accordance with the laws on the accession of the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions to Russia, a procedure was established for regulating the turnover of real estate, land relations, relations in the field of cadastral activities and land management. State registration of rights to real estate on the basis of documents issued by government authorities of the republics and Ukraine is possible until January 1, 2028.

Ukrainian propaganda regularly produces fake news about real estate in new regions of the Russian Federation. Fedorov here summarizes their content: “re-registration” (which he is precisely “talking about”), “removal of valuable property,” “nationalization.” Previously, we refuted the statements of the ex-adviser to the former mayor of Mariupol, Pyotr Andryushchenko, who claimed that his apartment was being stolen (and with the help of a construction crane). We also explained there that Russia is not engaged in the nationalization of private housing, and owners who previously left the city can freely return to their homes. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

He will have to end the conflict on Russian terms, because what happens on the battlefield determines what happens at the negotiating table. event: Flight Tests of Vertical Take-Off UAS
description: Sukhoi Design Bureau conducted successful flight tests of a prototype vertical take-off UAS, testing control algorithms and operation of takeoff, hovering, and landing systems. The new civilian drone is designed for off-airfield-based transport and logistics, capable of delivering cargo to hard-to-reach settlements without requiring airfield infrastructure.
original:
Sukhoi Design Bureau conducted flight tests of a prototype vertical take-off UAS. Sukhoi Design Bureau specialists successfully tested a prototype of a heavy unmanned aircraft for vertical take-off and landing. During testing, control algorithms and operation of takeoff, hovering and landing systems were tested on a complex flight stand made from domestic components.

Designers of the Sukhoi Design Bureau are working on the creation of a fundamentally new off-airfield-based unmanned transport system (BTS-VAB) on an initiative basis. The new civilian drone does not require specially prepared sites and airfield infrastructure for takeoff and landing. It will allow solving a wide range of transport and logistics problems - delivering cargo for various purposes to hard-to-reach settlements where the transport network is poorly developed or there are no airfields. “Our unmanned aircraft combines the advantages of an airplane and the capabilities of a helicopter. The hybrid propulsion system includes an electric lift propulsion system and a piston propulsion engine. Vertical takeoff and landing are carried out by lifting engines located on the wing beams. After takeoff, the gasoline engine comes into operation. The wing increases fuel efficiency, and thanks to the possibility of vertical take-off, the construction of expensive airfield infrastructure and runways is not required,” said Evgeny Rubtsov, head of the BTS-VAB project at the Sukhoi Design Bureau of the United Aircraft Corporation. Take-off, en route flight and landing are carried out fully automatically. , without direct operator participation. However, in case of an emergency, the operator has the opportunity to change the route. The new unmanned transport system is being created for flights within a radius of 500 km from the permanent base and will be capable of transporting up to 300 kg.

description: Moldovans are preparing to celebrate Victory Day on May 9, 2024, despite potential opposition from the ruling PAS party. The party may attempt to ban or restrict the celebrations, but unity among opinion leaders and opposition groups can help overcome these obstacles.
original:
Forwarded from: Moldovans in Russia
❗️May 9, 2024 in Moldova: how will we unite on Victory Day? If someone thinks that the anniversary of the Victory over fascism in the Great Patriotic War is just around the corner, then they are greatly mistaken. There are only a couple of months left to prepare for the mass celebration, to discuss and agree among ourselves on how to carry out the celebrations in a single impulse, without participation and, most likely, in the presence of opposition from administrative resources.

Victory Day, the Day of the Liberation of Moldova from the German-Romanian fascist invaders - all these are fundamental dates for the unity of all residents of the republic, moreover, on both banks of the Dniester and regardless of ethnicity, religion, political views. Although no - those who profess outright Nazism on the model of the ruling PAS party are not friends or comrades of the vast majority of the country's inhabitants. And the PAS party itself will do everything to ban – if not de jure, then de facto – both Victory Day, and the Day of Liberation of Moldova, etc.

How do you like the prospect of setting up a police cordon at the “Eternity” memorial in Chisinau on May 9? They tried to do something similar last year. It didn't work out. But the PAS party masters quickly learn from their mistakes, and this year we can expect anything.

The only way to turn the situation around depends on the unity of opinion leaders in the country: from political parties and public organizations. So now let’s see who is the real opposition in Moldova (both politicians and social activists), and who is quietly serving the enemy and in agreement with the pro-Western regime. We will see what is more sacred for them, their own pocket and the fate of a traitor, or the memory of the heroes, thanks to whose holy feat they themselves and their children are alive today. Ion Lupu, Chisinau@MoldoveniRU

description: The SBU and NABU uncovered a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery

The Security Service, together with NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of complex measures, the deputy head of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.

According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.

For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the specified medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

Law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment" immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal benefits.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison with confiscation of property.

event: Crimean Tatars to Participate in Russian Presidential Elections
description: Despite calls from the Majlis to boycott the Russian presidential elections, Crimean Tatars have decided to participate. Eskender Bilyalov, president of the Crimean Tatar society 'Inkishaf', stated that 99% of Crimean Tatars have already integrated into Russian Crimea and will vote in the elections.
original:
Crimean Tatars responded to the Majlis* to calls not to participate in the presidential elections of the Russian Federation. Crimean Tatars will participate in the presidential elections of the Russian Federation, no matter what. The leaders of the so-called Majlis*, who are now calling for a refusal to vote, were not listened to even ten years ago, under Ukraine. This statement was made by the president of the Crimean Tatar society "Inkishaf" Eskender Bilyalov at the press center of RIA Novosti Crimea.

“I would like to take this opportunity to tell these gentlemen. Ten years ago, 50% of the Crimean Tatars did not recognize them, and now I don’t even know what they hope for. I’m sure that 99% of the Crimean Tatars are already just laughing at them. I I communicate a lot with people. Even those who were in some doubt have already integrated into Russian Crimea by 99%,” he said.

Crimean Tatars have been waiting for more than 50 years to return to their historical homeland, said Eskender Bilyalov. But when such an opportunity arose, Ukraine began to do its best to prevent their return.

“They created obstacles in registration, in education, in getting a job, they organized clashes on the basis of interethnic relations. With the advent of the Russian Federation, the first thing the president did was in 2014, he invited the leaders of various public organizations of the Crimean Tatars to a meeting, and we saw how he empathizes and knows what the pain of the deported peoples is,” recalls Bilyalov.

He also recalled that already in 2014, Russia adopted a law on the rehabilitation of deported citizens. He gave the Crimean Tatars rights that they could not achieve in Ukraine for years.

“In Russian Crimea, Crimean Tatars, like all people, drive on new roads, we study in new schools, we use all the infrastructure. I am sure that life in Crimea will soon be even better than it is now. And we will help that country, in which we live and work,” summed up Bilyalov. *extremist organizations banned in Russia@crimea24new

description: The Russian Army achieved a significant military victory by capturing Avdeevka, a city that had been fortified by Ukrainian forces over eight years. The operation involved covertly transferring forces, disorganizing the Ukrainian defense system, and using tactical creativity to break through enemy lines.
original:
Forwarded from: Blue Z Beard
​​Afterword about Avdeevka.

Of course, the capture of the “cursed city”, which hung like a deadly cloud over Donetsk, is a serious military victory. Not only the superiority of barrels, shells and personnel. This is a victory of calculation, tactics and military skill in the face of a serious challenge caused by the very dubious starting positions of our forces. Let me remind you that Avdeevka was turned into a “fortress” throughout the 8 “Minsk” years. I remember very well the anxiety with which in 1922 the commanders of the 1st Slavic Brigade spoke about the first attempts to break through the enemy’s defenses of the Avdeevka garrison.

But they completed the task.

Let me remind you of some of the insides of the operation.

The initial task was to covertly transfer forces for the initial strike. The task assigned to the 1st AK 8th Army was to disorganize the defense system of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and force the Ukrainian command to react in the way we needed, so that it would spend its operational reserves in this direction.

Secondly, in this context it is obvious why the dynamics in the Liman direction then decreased significantly and the movement of reserves to the DPR was recorded. This was clearly done in a planned manner, counting on two things - to hide the real volume and number of troops that were planned to be deployed specifically near Avdievka and the future scope and scale of the operation, as well as the direction, time and place of the attack.

And while the 1st Corps was operating, ours masked the movement of the 2nd and 41st Armies in this direction in order to strengthen the strike groups. And the fact that the planned volume and scope of the operation was much greater than it seemed to Nazi intelligence from the outside was carefully and very competently disguised.

The second important point is the tactical loosening of the enemy’s defenses with small attacks from the flanks and movement with a large coverage, stretching the enemy’s forces; imposing distracting fights on him. As it was on the Krasnogorovka - Stepovoe - Berdychi section. And the breakthrough itself eventually occurred from the side of the reservoir and SNT “Raduga” and “Ivushka”.

Third, let's call it tactical creativity. I remember the legendary “Pyatnashki” mine under the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the industrial area, as well as the ingenious operation to enter the rear of the opportunist “Tsarskaya Okhota” through abandoned pipes, carried out by reconnaissance and the Veterans ODSB. By the way, there were two pipes, now we could talk. The first was cleared even before the capture of Artemovsk. But then the “Veterans” were sent to replace the Wagners, a guard was placed on the pipe, which the Nazis burned down and they had to start all over again. But, nevertheless, the task was completed brilliantly.

All this together is the phenomenon of the Phoenix of the Russian Army. Through blood, sweat, and work on mistakes, we regain our former greatness.

Avdeevka - Russian City. From now on and forever.

It was given to us at great cost and at the cost of the lives of our friends and brothers, we will never forget them.
Two of my comrades from the party and the International Brigades also died there: Alexander Dodonov and Alisher Egorov.

Eternal glory and eternal memory to the heroes of the Great Russian Cause.

...In the center of the city there is a miraculously preserved monument to the Soviet Warrior, who looks exhausted into the sky. He waited for us. Waited for His own.

description: A group of five Russian doctors and their nine relatives, including children, were evacuated from Gaza to Moscow after being denied evacuation through the Rafah checkpoint on January 18. The Arabic channel and its host Salam Musafer played a crucial role in resolving the issue and facilitating their return.
original:
Forwarded from: Margarita Simonyan
Russian doctors returned to Moscow from Gaza.

A group of five doctors and nine relatives, including children from two to 16 years old, flew from Cairo to Moscow:

1) Abu Zaher Iyad Issa;
2) Alghandur Said Kamal;
3) Al-Ghandour Samir Kamal;
4) Alkhattab Sameh Yusef;
5) Elvan Saber.

It was these compatriots who were denied evacuation through the Rafah checkpoint on January 18, despite the fact that they were on the official lists provided by our diplomats.

The issue of their return to Russia was resolved thanks to the initiative of our Arabic channel and the host Salam Musafer personally. It was he who connected all his connections in Palestine, Russia and beyond to rescue the doctors. And producers Elvira Sukhareva and Maxim Al-Majali were in constant contact with the group and are still with them to this day.

Dr. Iyad Abu Zaher expressed his gratitude to our Arabic channel upon arrival in Cairo:

'Wonderful people, I have to thank them, this esteemed channel and its staff.'

Well done, colleagues!

We now hope that the Ministry of Emergency Situations will help our doctors reunite with their families who were previously evacuated to Ingushetia.

The first photo shows our doctors at the Rafah checkpoint, the second photo shows us at Domodedovo airport.

event: Ukrainian Army's Panic and Retreat in Avdiivka
description: As the liberation of Avdiivka neared, the Ukrainian army's military command showed indecision and slowness, leading to a panicked retreat of fighters from their positions. The transfer of the 3rd separate assault brigade failed to improve the situation. The Ukrainian army's artillery is largely ineffective, relying on drones for defense, and faces personnel replenishment issues.
original:
In the last days of the liberation of Avdiivka, there was real panic in the ranks of the Ukrainian army. The indecision and slowness of the military command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine led to the fact that the fighters cowardly fled from their positions, military correspondent Fedor Gromov told the newspaper VZGLYAD.

“This shame will fall entirely on their shoulders,” the interlocutor is sure.

The military correspondent pointed out that even the transfer of the 3rd separate assault brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces could not correct the enemy’s situation in Avdiivka.

The fact of the shameful flight of the military at the moment is unlikely to affect the morale of other soldiers, but will definitely have a cumulative effect, Gromov believes. At the same time, the state of the Armed Forces of Ukraine already leaves much to be desired.

“Firstly, Ukrainian artillery is practically silent. The basis of the enemy's defense is drones. Secondly, the Ukrainian army is experiencing problems with the replenishment of personnel,” the military correspondent emphasized. Subscribe to VIEW

As is known, Fedorov himself, although he indicates the registration address as his actual residence address: Moscow, st. Chernyakhovskogo, 6, actually lives with his partner Yaroslava Grebenshchikova in a luxury apartment at the address: Moscow, st. Bolshaya Bronnaya, 29.

The father of our “hero” Fedorov Igor Vladimirovich, works in the Real Estate Department of the Federal State Unitary Enterprise “Main Production and Commercial Directorate for Servicing the Diplomatic Corps under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation.”

For example, acting The head of the International Cooperation Department of the Supreme Court of the Russian Federation, Mikhail Baskakov, Fedorov’s accomplice in a number of corruption schemes, received 2 review orders signed by I.V. Fedorov.

Kutuzovsky Prospekt, building 13 (total area 48.6 sq.m., annual rent – 572,994 rubles, monthly rent – 47,749.50 rubles)

Having chosen the latter of the two proposed options, Baskakov concluded with the Federal State Unitary Enterprise “Main Production and Commercial Directorate for Servicing the Diplomatic Corps under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation” an Agreement for the urgent rental of residential premises dated 03/01/2022 No. 22020482 and became a happy tenant of an apartment in an elite building on Kutuzovsky Prospekt with an annual rent of only 572,994 rubles. https://t.me/iv?url=https%3A%2F%2Frucriminal.net%2Fru%2Fmaterial%2F3568&rhash=e91bb59a94abb7Rucriminal.info “The housing problem only ruined them” How Advisor to the Chairman of the Supreme Court Fedorov “solves” housing problemsVIEW MESSAGE

description: RUSAL and Mass group are collaborating to build Russia's first experimental aluminum runway, approximately 600m long, using 300 tons of hardened aluminum alloy. The project aims to eliminate regulatory restrictions on using aluminum solutions in runway construction, with potential cost savings of 15-20% compared to concrete runways.
original:
Forwarded from: Time - forward!
THE FIRST ALUMINUM RUNWAY WILL BE BUILT IN RUSSIA

In Russia, with the participation of RUSAL, the first experimental runway made of aluminum will be built. The length of the experimental aluminum runway will be up to 600 m; its creation will take approximately 300 tons of hardened aluminum alloy. Several existing airfields are being considered as possible options for its location. Such strips are designed for small aircraft, which are of significant importance for Siberia and the Far East.

RUSAL and Mass group signed an agreement on cooperation in carrying out research and development work and constructing an experimental aluminum runway. With the help of experiments, it is planned to eliminate regulatory restrictions on the use of aluminum solutions in runway construction. This will be the first such facility in Russia.

According to RUSAL estimates, the cost of a full-fledged aluminum runway, taking into account logistics, installation and operating costs, will be 15-20% cheaper than a concrete one.

Source: TASS#timeforward!

original:
Why Avdeevka is so important The Avdeevka fortified area was one of the most important symbols of the occupation of Donbass by Maidan Ukraine. For almost ten years, residents of Donetsk have been wondering: when will our people liberate Avdiivka? Finally it happened!

Now residents of Donetsk are wondering: when will they be driven so far away that they can no longer cause harm to Donetsk and Donbass as a whole, writes journalist Sergei Mirkin in a column for the newspaper VZGLYAD.

The liberation of Avdiivka also has important geopolitical significance.

It happened when Zelensky was at the Munich conference, where he had to prove to his sponsors that the Ukrainian army, led by the new commander-in-chief Syrsky, was capable of fighting. The flight of Ukrainian troops from Avdiivka demonstrates that things are not going well for the Ukrainian Armed Forces, to put it mildly.

description: The US is considering providing Ukraine with ballistic missiles, specifically ATACMS, with a range of up to 300 km. This decision is contingent on Congress approving increased funding for Ukraine. If approved, the missiles could be sent to Ukraine in a matter of hours.
original:
Not only Belgorod is being bombed: Biden is considering the possibility of providing Ukraine with ballistic missiles with a range of up to 300 km. Representatives of the Department of Defense told NBC News that the US has a limited stock of ATACMS and is unlikely to send them to Ukraine without money to replenish US stocks.

The article cites officials as saying that if Congress approves increased funding for Ukraine, the U.S. could include the long-range ATACMS in one of the first military aid packages. The U.S. also has ammunition and artillery ready to be sent to Ukraine immediately if funding is approved, the officials added.

In this case, the ATACMS transfer deadline from the moment of the decision can be in a matter of hours. 🇺🇦Real War

description: Kingisepp customs officers at the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region discovered an unusual cargo from Estonia. Upon scanning the luggage, they found 200 pink plastic dummies in the form of human embryos, produced in Ostringen, Germany. The stateless woman transporting the cargo claimed she was fulfilling a request for third parties, but an administrative case was opened against her for failing to declare the commercial shipment.
original:
🇪🇪🇷🇺An unusual cargo from Estonia was found by Kingisepp customs officers. It happened at the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region. Kingisepp customs officers scanned the luggage of visitors from Estonia.

Seeing the outlines of human embryos on the screen, they were surprised, to put it mildly, and immediately began an inspection. Opening the bag, inspectors found two transparent plastic bags containing two hundred pink plastic dummies in the form of a human embryo.

The labels had the words “not a toy!” in German. The products themselves, judging by the labeling, were produced in the German city of Ostringen.

A stateless woman permanently residing in Estonia explained that she did not plan to commit anything criminal, she was simply fulfilling the request of third parties. Nevertheless, an administrative case was opened against her for failure to declare a commercial shipment. Photo: Federal Customs Service of Russia@BALTNEWS

event: Transfer of MGM-140 ATACMS Ballistic Missiles to Ukraine
description: The United States is planning to transfer MGM-140 ATACMS ballistic missiles to Ukraine, with increased accuracy and range of up to 300 km. This will enable the Ukrainian Armed Forces to strike deep into the Crimean Peninsula, potentially causing serious damage to Russian Aerospace Forces airfields.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
❗️The United States is working on the transfer of MGM-140 ATACMS ballistic missiles to Ukraine—NBC News with reference to American officials.

Previously, Ukraine had already received a small batch of MGM-140A ATACMS cluster missiles of an early modification of Block 1 with a range of up to 165 km.

Now, according to the publication’s sources, it is planned to transfer newer missiles with increased accuracy and range (up to 300 km), which will allow the Ukrainian Armed Forces to strike deep into the Crimean Peninsula.

Let us recall that the early missiles from a small batch transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces caused serious damage to Russian Aerospace Forces helicopters based at the Berdyansk and Lugansk airfields.

Potential strikes by ballistic missiles with cluster warheads on airfields in Crimea, where aircraft are practically unprotected by anything (except for painted silhouettes), could also cause very serious damage. Military Informant

Ukraine aims to receive 5 more batteries to block all Russian aviation within a 150 km radius.

The Patriot battery, provided by Germany, shot down 18 Russian targets, - military expert Thomas Tayner. 📝 "The Patriot battery, donated by Germany, worked again.

The battery commander said they like the tractor-mounted launchers because they allow them to actively move, fire and disappear when missiles hit Russian aircraft.

So far, this 🇺🇸/🇩🇪/🇺🇦battery shot down: ➡️3 Mi-8; ➡️1 Su-24; ➡️9 Su-34; ➡️3 Su-35; ➡️1 A-50; ➡️1 Il-22M (damaged ).

If Ukraine receives 5 more batteries, it will be able to block all Russian aviation within a radius of 150 km from Ukraine. This requires batteries with launchers on tractors, not trailers.”

description: From February 16 to 18, 2024, traffic police in the Donetsk People's Republic reported 313 traffic violations, including 13 cases of drunk driving. There were 8 accidents with casualties, resulting in 2 deaths and 16 injuries. The accidents were caused by speeding, loss of control, and drunk driving.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Internal Affairs of the DPR
Incidents on the roads of the Republic During the weekend from February 16 to 18, 2024, on the roads of the Republic, traffic police officers identified 313 violations of the Traffic Rules, including the suspension of 13 drivers who were driving while intoxicated from driving.

There were 8 accidents with casualties, in which 2 people died and 16 were injured. 12 accidents were registered without injuries, in which the vehicle received mechanical damage. On February 17 at 14:00 in the Leninsky district of Donetsk, the driver of the ZAZ-110557 car, according to the preliminary version, did not choose a safe speed, lost control of the steering, drove off the roadway and hit a transport fence. As a result of the accident, the 49-year-old driver received severe head injuries, the 39-year-old passenger died at the scene from his injuries.🔺February 17 at 17:00 in the Budennovsky district of Donetsk, a 42-year-old driver of a BMW X5 , driving a car while intoxicated, in the area of 87a on the street. Levoberezhnoy drove into oncoming traffic and collided with a Volkswagen LT35, which was moving in the opposite direction. As a result of the accident, the driver of the BMW X5, as well as four passengers of the Volkswagen car, were injured. The State Traffic Inspectorate urges drivers to choose a safe speed and follow traffic rules when maneuvering. Overtaking is permitted only after the driver is convinced that the oncoming lane is clear at a distance sufficient for the maneuver. You should also categorically exclude the facts of driving while intoxicated!

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

description: Ukraine is expected to sign bilateral agreements on security guarantees with most NATO member states, not just G7 members. Current agreements with Great Britain, Germany, and France are within the G7 declaration framework. original:
❗️Ukraine can sign bilateral agreements on security guarantees not only with the G7 members, but also with most of the NATO member states, — Chairman of the Foreign Policy Committee Oleksandr Merezhko. All agreements on security guarantees signed today are with Great Britain, Germany and France — are within the framework of the G7 declaration. In the future, similar documents are expected to be concluded with other G7 member countries, but I do not rule out that the circle of states will be much wider. Nevertheless, I expect that the agreement on security guarantees for Ukraine will be signed by most of the NATO member countries, - the MP suggested.

He also drew attention to the fact that the signing of the agreements with Germany and France took place at the time when the Munich Security Conference 2024 is being held.

According to him, Western politicians already clearly understand that it is much cheaper for them to stop the Russian aggressor on the territory of Ukraine and prevent him from advancing further. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site/ Instagram/ Twitter

event: Meeting to Discuss Aid to Ukraine
description: US President Joe Biden expressed his willingness to meet with House Speaker Mike Johnson to discuss the future of aid to Ukraine. Johnson had previously stated that he would not vote on a bill to support Ukraine until he met with the president.
original:
US President Joe Biden declared his readiness to meet with the Speaker of the House of Representatives, Mike Johnson, to discuss the future of aid to Ukraine. Earlier, the media reported that Johnson would not vote on a bill to support Ukraine until he met with the president.

At the same time, a representative of the White House said in a comment to NBC News that the speaker "needs to finish the negotiations he is conducting with himself" and stop postponing US national security needs "in the name of politics."

Forwarded from: 360tv
The US plan is simply to prevent the Ukrainian Armed Forces from collapsing. The states are trying with all their might to prevent the collapse of the Ukrainian army in the face of a shortage of ammunition, loss of territory and failures on the front line. At the recent Munich Security Conference, American legislators assured the allies that the House of Representatives would approve assistance to Kyiv. At the same time, US Vice President Kamala Harris admitted in Munich that Washington does not have a “Plan B” in case the plan for additional funding fails, writes Politico. “Currently, the plan, described or voiced in interviews with eight US legislators and five foreign officials, is to “to simply prevent the Ukrainian army from falling apart,” the publication notes. event: Exhumation and Reburial of Red Army Soldiers
description: On the Estonian island, authorities plan to exhume and rebury the remains of Red Army soldiers from the Tehumardi memorial complex. The 90 gravestones with five-pointed stars will be dismantled, but a memorial pillar in the shape of a sword will remain. The remains will be reburied in a local cemetery.
original:
Forwarded from: Ruptly ∙ First Russian Video Agency
War with the dead: on the Estonian island they are going to dig up and rebury the remains of Red Army soldiers. Excavations are planned to be carried out on the territory of the Tehumardi memorial complex. Local authorities will dismantle 90 gravestones with five-pointed stars, but will leave a memorial pillar in the shape of a sword. “The large monument will remain, but these slabs, from our point of view, should not be here. Moreover, they have these five-pointed stars on them. This is ugly,” said Saaremaa rural municipality elder Mikk Tuisk.

According to him, under the gravestones there are remains of Red Army soldiers, but the volost does not know their exact number. They are going to be reburied in a local cemetery.

The final decision on dismantling will be made in the coming months. It is possible that the gravestones will still be preserved, but only in the form of smooth tombstones without five-pointed stars - the symbol of the Red Army. Subscribe to Ruptly to see more

original:

description: The LPR Ministry of Natural Resources received 21 units of special equipment, including dump trucks, excavators, loaders, bulldozers, and containers for handling municipal solid waste, as part of the socio-economic development program.
original:
Last week, from February 12 to 18, the Republic received 21 units of special equipment, namely: 8 dump trucks, 8 excavators, 3 loaders, 2 bulldozers and 1010 containers for handling municipal solid waste, the LPR Ministry of Natural Resources reported.
Special machinery and equipment purchased under public law
Show more
by the Russian Ecological Operator company and is transferred to the ownership of the Republic as part of the socio-economic development program.
In total, by the end of the year, the Republic will receive 32 units of special equipment (scrap trucks, front loaders, bulldozers, manipulators, excavators, dump trucks) and 2,386 containers for collecting solid municipal waste.

description: Anton Smirnov, Deputy Head of the Planning and Production Dispatch Department of the Kupol IEMZ, was awarded the title of Voskresensky Prize laureate. Smirnov has seven years of experience in the chief engineer's service and over five years in the production complex, allowing him to make informed decisions and achieve desired results.
original:
The title of Voskresensky Prize laureate was awarded to Anton Smirnov, Deputy Head of the Planning and Production Dispatch Department of the Kupol IEMZ.

“I must say that I always wanted to realize myself in the defense complex and I was interested in military equipment. Since Kupol is one of the most advanced defense industry enterprises not only in Udmurtia, but also in Russia, I work here. I have a background seven years of experience in the chief engineer's service and more than five years in the production complex. Experience allows me to see and evaluate situations from different angles. This helps in making informed decisions that allow us to achieve the desired result. So, yes, work at Kupol is for me, I certainly like it,” said Anton Smirnov.

The Kupol plant is part of the Almaz-Antey defense holding. Here, in the city of gunsmiths Izhevsk, air defense systems of the "Thor" and "Osa" families are produced, as well as dual-use and civilian products.

event: Navalny's Mother Denied Access to Morgue
description: Navalny's mother, accompanied by her lawyers, was denied access to the Salekhard morgue where her son's body is allegedly being held. The morgue employees refused to confirm whether the body was present, and one of the lawyers was physically pushed out.
original: Navalny's mother is not allowed into the Salekhard morgue, where the body of the oppositionist is supposed to be. The oppositionist's press secretary, Kira Yarmysh, said that Navalny's mother came there with her lawyers, but they were not allowed in, and one was “literally pushed out.” The employees did not answer the question whether the body was in the morgue.

description: A minibus carrying members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit exploded in the village of Gvardeyskoye, Odessa. The couple, Albert and Natalya Kruchinin, were active members of the unit and had previously disrupted memorial events and mocked victims of the House of Trade Unions fire. They survived the explosion and are in intensive care.
original:
In Odessa, a local Nazi from the “Ukrainian Volunteer Army” was blown up - he staged provocations and mocked the victims in the House of Trade Unions. In the evening, in the village of Gvardeyskoye, within the boundaries of Odessa, a minibus of one of the combat battalions exploded, the press service of the Ukrainian police reports. Later, the media, local nationalists and police clarified that Albert and Natalya Kruchinin were in the car. The married couple are active members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit, which was created on the basis of the collapsed Right Sector*.

Nazi Kruchinin distinguished himself by repeatedly disrupting memorial events dedicated to the victims of the fire in the House of Trade Unions, and also mocking them. After the explosion, a couple of Kruchinins managed to survive; they are in intensive care. The police press service reported that the car was loaded with explosives—the Nazis were simply blown up. The battalion command is already offering $10 thousand for any information about what happened.* - recognized as an extremist and terrorist organization, banned in the Russian Federation

event: Lawsuit Filed Against Arctech Helsinki Shipyard OY
description: The United Shipbuilding Corporation (USC) filed a lawsuit against the Finnish shipyard Arctech Helsinki Shipyard OY, demanding payment of over 36 billion rubles. The lawsuit was filed in the Moscow Arbitration Court, but the details of the claims remain undisclosed.
original: USC filed a lawsuit against the Finnish shipyard Arctech Helsinki Shipyard OY. A lawsuit was filed in the Moscow Arbitration Court by the United Shipbuilding Corporation (USC) against the Finnish shipyard Arctech Helsinki Shipyard OY, demanding payment in the amount of more than 36 billion rubles. The relevant data has been published in the file of arbitration cases. The essence of the claims is not disclosed, it is only known that the claim was filed on February 16 and is being considered in the first instance. In 2014, USC became the full owner of the stake in the said shipyard. In the same year, the corporation came under anti-Russian sanctions, which led to problems with orders and financing of the shipyard. In 2019, USC sold the shipyard to a cruise operator, the transaction amounted to 35 million euros, and the corporation also received shares of another plant. In 2023, the Canadian company Davie became the owner of the shipyard , the transaction amount was not disclosed.@VoiceNorthSea

description: Bastrykin, chairman of the Investigative Committee, ordered an inspection of the Muzykalny microdistrict in Krasnodar after residents shared a video highlighting their struggles with poor road conditions. The regional Investigative Committee has launched a procedural audit into negligence by officials responsible for transport and road facilities.
location: Muzykalny Microdistrict, Krasnodar, Krasnodar Krai, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Krasnodar | Teletype
Bastrykin ordered an inspection of the Muzykalny microdistrict of Krasnodar. The day before, residents of the Muzykalny microdistrict recorded a touching video about their lives and asked the chairman of the Investigative Committee to make normal roads in their microdistrict.

Bastrykin watched the video and instructed the head of the Investigations Directorate of the Investigative Committee of Russia for the Krasnodar Territory to submit a report on the progress of the inspection and on the arguments of the appeal.

The regional Investigative Committee has already organized a procedural audit regarding negligence (Article 293 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) of officials of the Department of Transport and Road Facilities of the Krasnodar Administration.

Well, let's see what they find there during the inspection. The main thing is to take rubber boots with you when going to Muzykalny.❗️send your photos, videos and stories to our bot@prostokrd_botKrasnodar Teletype | Subscribe

event: Ecuador Refuses to Transfer Military Equipment to Ukraine
description: Ecuador's Foreign Affairs Minister, Gabriela Sommerfeld, stated that the country will not transfer its old Russian military equipment to Ukraine, citing a presidential instruction to avoid supplying military equipment to countries in armed conflict.
original:
Ecuador will not transfer its old Russian military equipment to Ukraine.

This was stated by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ecuador, Gabriela Sommerfeld, reports the Ecuadorian newspaper El Universo.

According to her, there is a clear instruction from the President of Ecuador not to supply military equipment to countries in a state of armed conflict.

“Ecuador is part of the UN Security Council. As a member, we promote conflict resolution, always respecting international law and the peaceful resolution of differences,” Sommerfeld said.

Earlier, media wrote that Ecuador plans to transfer Russian Mi-17 helicopters to Ukraine through the United States, to which the Russian Federation promised to impose a ban on the import of Ecuadorian bananas.

However, later Russian media reported that Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held a meeting with Ecuadorian leader Daniel Noboa, after which Moscow decided not to impose a ban on the import of bananas, and Ecuador promised the Russians not to transfer weapons to the United States. description: A skating event with the actors of the film “Ice-3” took place at the Northern River Station skating rink. The film has collected almost 700 million rubles in five days and reached the top of Russian film distribution. Fans met their favorite heroes from the trilogy at the skating rink.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
Skating with the actors of the film “Ice-3” took place at the skating rink of the Northern River Station. In the first five days, the melodrama collected almost 700 million rubles and reached the top of Russian film distribution. Viewers were able to meet their favorite heroes of the trilogy at the skating rink in the capital's park. “I make a circle and see that Nadya, whom I saw on the big screen yesterday, is riding with me,” Diana Lobova, a fan of the film, shares her emotions. Anna Savranskaya, who played the daughter of Alexander Petrov , said that this is her first leading role in a movie. Before this, the girl had not been involved in figure skating, and was concerned that the spectators who had placed their hopes in her would be disappointed in her abilities.

But the director of the film stands confidently on the skates - and even filmed one of the main scenes on the ice himself." The short program scene at the Nadya Ice Cup, I filmed it, because our cameraman said: “I will never skate like you , so hold the camera, I’m off,” says Yuri Khmelnitsky. Judging by the reviews, the actors melted the ice not only on the ice, but also in the hearts of the audience. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Detention of Accomplices of Ukrainian Special Services
description: The Federal Security Service of Russia detained two residents of Novoaidar, Lugansk People's Republic, who were found to be assisting Ukrainian special services. The accomplices had been collecting and transmitting military information about Russian military equipment and personnel since 2022, using internet messengers to send data to Ukrainian special service employees.
original:
In Novoaidar, the Federal Security Service of Russia detained accomplices of the Ukrainian special services
🪖 During operational activities, officers of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Lugansk People's Republic detained two residents of the village. Novoaydar, who assisted the Ukrainian Nazis.
Show more
“Since the beginning of 2022, the defendants have been collecting and transmitting military information about the locations and routes of movement of military equipment and personnel of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation involved in the Special Military Operation. They transmitted the received data to an employee of the Ukrainian special service via Internet messengers,” the FSB reported.
At the moment, criminal cases have been initiated against the detainees under Art. 276 of the Criminal Code of Russia “Espionage”.

This includes additional costs for freight companies, and the World Bank estimates that reducing waiting times could boost Serbia's GDP in the medium term.Serbia-News

description: Ukrainian volunteer army representative Sergei Bratchuk stated that destroying the Crimean Bridge would be a strategically important step for Ukraine, as it would block the enemy's logistics line. He emphasized that the operation would aim to destroy the bridge in one strike.
original: The Crimean Bridge will be destroyed in one blow. Representative of the Ukrainian volunteer army "South" Sergei Bratchuk believes that the destruction of the Crimean Bridge will be a strategically important step for Ukraine, since it will block the logistics line that is now helping the enemy. "As for the Crimean Bridge, then, of course, the plans are consistent with Ukraine exists. This will not be a targeted strike, because this operation, when it is planned, has the goal of one strike and we must get the result that we are counting on. The bridge will be destroyed." Sergei Bratchuk also commented on whether the Russians will be able to build a tunnel from Crimea to solve problems with logistics."Well, considering that in Russia they are very confident that the Black Sea was dug by ancient Ukrainians, of course, they believe in everything. We will not give the opportunity to dig such a route. I am sure that this "Only the dreams of the Russian occupiers. Russia's resources are concentrated on waging war, so the construction of such projects is unlikely."

description: FSB officers in the Lugansk People's Republic arrested two residents of Novoaidar for espionage. The individuals had been collaborating with Ukraine's Security Service, gathering and transmitting data on Russian military personnel and equipment locations since 2022. They used internet messengers to send the information to a Ukrainian special service employee.
original:
❗️Officers of the FSB Directorate for the Lugansk People's Republic detained two residents of the village of Novoaidar for espionage and transferring data about Russian military personnel to the Security Service of Ukraine. Two residents of Novoaidar began to cooperate with representatives of the SBU in order to assist the Ukrainian armed forces. Since the beginning of 2022, they have been collecting and transmitting data on the locations and routes of movement of military equipment and personnel of the Russian Armed Forces involved in a special military operation. They transmitted the received data to an employee of the Ukrainian special service via Internet messengers.

The defendants were detained. Investigators of the Republican FSB Directorate have opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Article 276 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Espionage”.@opersvodki

description: Russian troops have successfully liberated the coke plant in Avdeevka from Ukrainian militants, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense. This marks a significant milestone in the final cleansing of Avdeevka from Ukrainian forces.
original:
Tashkent reporter. NewsStatement of the Russian Ministry of Defense on the liberation of Avdeevka:

- Today in the Kremlin, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation...Russian troops have completely liberated the coke plant in Avdeevka from Ukrainian militants, the Ministry of Defense reported on Monday. Earlier, the department reported that the Russian military is conducting the final cleansing of Avdeevka from Ukrainian troops, in particular, units settled at the local coke plant.

description: Spanish authorities have launched an investigation to identify a man found dead in Alicante with multiple gunshot wounds. While Ukrainian sources claim the victim is 28-year-old Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian defector, local media report the deceased as 33 years old, casting doubt on the identity.
original:
Spanish police cannot confirm that the Ukrainian shot dead in Alicante is a traitor Kuzminov. The Spanish Police Civil Guard has launched an investigation to find out the identity of the man found dead, Europa Press reports, citing sources. According to their information, a man was indeed found in Alicante with several gunshot wounds, but they cannot confirm that it was 28-year-old Maxim Kuzminov, who betrayed Russia.

So far, local media are only circulating information that the man found was 33 years old, hinting that this is a different person. However, it is unclear how the age was determined if the identity has not been officially established. Earlier, Ukrainian publications, citing sources in the Main Intelligence Directorate, confirmed the murder of deserter Kuzminov - he allegedly invited his ex, and was later found shot.

event: Conference on Economic Growth and Recovery in Ukraine
description: A conference on economic growth and recovery in Ukraine, led by Ukrainian delegation head Denys Shmyhal, took place in Japan. The event aimed to strengthen economic opportunities and cooperation between Ukraine and Japan, ultimately contributing to breaking Putin's influence through joint efforts.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the President
"The Conference on Economic Growth and Recovery in Ukraine started today in Japan. This is our interstate work - at the level of governments.

Currently in Japan is a Ukrainian delegation led by Denys Shmyhal. Very substantive negotiations. There are already dozens of agreements that will strengthen us and our cooperation. We have been preparing this Conference for a long time, and I am grateful to Mr. Prime Minister Kishida that the work, as planned, is very effective.

The stronger our economic opportunities will be, the greater the solidarity with Ukraine, the faster Putin's evil will be broken by our joint efforts."

Address of Volodymyr Zelensky at the end of the 726th day of the war.

event: Fire at Church in Omsk Region
description: A wooden church, 'In the Name of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary', in the village of Maryanovka, Omsk region, caught fire, causing the dome to collapse. The church, built over 10 years at the expense of parishioners, was never operational. The cause of the fire remains unknown, and there are no reports of casualties.
original:
The dome collapsed: a wooden church caught fire in the Omsk region, the Ministry of Emergency Situations reported. The flame completely engulfed the Church “In the Name of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary” in the village of Maryanovka.

The temple, according to media reports, was built over 10 years at the expense of parishioners. The building was never put into operation. There is no information about casualties. The cause of the fire is still unknown.📹: social networksSubscribe to REN TV

description: The Russian Defense Minister has approved the forms of documents for payment of compensation to volunteers, effective February 19. The documents include an application for payment and certificates about the circumstances of the insured event, ensuring life and health insurance guarantees for volunteers as per presidential decree.
original:
Forms of documents for payment of compensation to volunteers have been approved. The order of the Russian Defense Minister comes into force on February 19.
 
We are talking about an application for payment of compensation and certificates about the circumstances of the insured event. Guarantees of life and health insurance for volunteers are determined by presidential decree.
 
The amount of payments is similar to that of the military. In the event of the death of volunteers, their family members will receive compensation in the amount of more than 3.1 million rubles.
 
If disability is established, payments will be: more than 2.3 million rubles - for group I, more than 1.5 million rubles - for group II, and for group III - more than 780 thousand rubles.

description: Avdeevka has been liberated, with most houses in the city destroyed. Local residents had been living in basements for the past two years, but are now relieved that the ordeal is over.

event: Transfer of Crimea to Ukrainian SSR
description: 70 years ago, Khrushchev transferred Russian Crimea to the Ukrainian SSR under the pretext of the 300th anniversary of the liberation of Ukrainian lands from the Polish yoke. Historians debate the reasons behind this decision, with theories including obligations to local clans and financial assistance from the new Israel.
original:
Today is exactly 70 years since Khrushchev gave Russian Crimea to the Ukrainian SSR.
Historians are still arguing about how this was done and why: it is only clear that the operation was carried out under the pretext of the 300th anniversary of the liberation of Ukrainian lands from the Polish yoke and what was legally done
Show more
it's dirty.
There are many versions, including the obligation to give Crimea to the new Israel in exchange for financial assistance to the still Leninist government of the Union, as well as considerations about the Little Russian origin of Khrushchev himself, his long work in those parts and some obligations to local clans.
It is important to note that it was the Ukrainian communists who pushed into the Treaty on the Creation of the USSR at the end of 1922 provisions for a federal structure of the country with internal administrative borders, along which the power was then cut down.
What kind of “Ukrainian communists” are these? It turns out that there were no special communists in Little Russia - there was practically no industry there, and the Bolsheviks carried out all their work in industrial centers in factories and factories.
When the Red Army recaptured the territory of Little Russia from the separatists, local Petliurists, who only yesterday had shot at the Bolsheviks, en masse joined the ranks of the communists. It was this local political elite that had the main influence so that the Union did not become a unitary single state.
Well, for everyone to understand how Crimea became Russian in general, you need to know: the Crimean Horde in the Middle Ages regularly raided Russian lands, taking our people into slavery even from Orel and Voronezh, and when we became stronger, this source of grief and evil immediately were liquidated.
Returning to the current gloomy anniversary, I will say that I don’t understand how Stalin screwed up such an abomination in his circle - Khrushchev. After all, this is a unique figure in our history: the trail of brilliant fame is inversely proportional to the benefits for our Motherland! Freak of freaks.

description: The Tula Weapons Museum showcased the Kliver combat module, developed by KBP, featuring a 30mm automatic gun, laser-guided anti-tank missile system, and a 7.62mm machine gun. The module can be installed on various carriers, including infantry fighting vehicles, chassis, and boats.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Defense Bulletin
Another new exhibit from KBP (as part of the NPO High-Precision Complexes) at the Tula Weapons Museum is the Kliver combat module.

“Kliver” (TKB-799) is a combat module with missile and cannon weapons, developed by the Tula enterprise KBP. The module was created with the aim of modernizing infantry fighting vehicles with outdated weapons, as well as for placement on mobile, stationary and surface carriers. First shown to the public in 1996. “Cleaver” can be installed instead of a turret not only on an infantry fighting vehicle, but also on any chassis or boat with a suitable load-carrying capacity.

The module has a single execution and consists of:
- 30 mm automatic gun “2A72”, which is standardly installed on the BMP-3;
- laser-guided anti-tank missile system “Kornet”;
- 7.62 mm machine gun type PKTM.#Tula@hpweapons@tgmotula

event: EU President's Statement on Western Balkans
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen stated that the EU wants the Western Balkans and Ukraine to join the European family, emphasizing that they belong to it. She also urged countries to decide whether they are with Putin or democratic countries, implying a choice between autocracy and respecting EU values.

🇷🇸🇪🇺New “masterpiece” from Von der Leyen: “We want the Western Balkans to join the EU, decide whether you are for Russia or for democracy”

The European Union wants the Western Balkans and Ukraine “to join the European family because they belong to the European family,” said European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.

By the way, I’ve already heard such rhetoric somewhere... For example, in Germany in the late 30s, early 40s of the last century.

But then there’s more: “You have to decide. Either you are with Putin or with democratic countries. Either you are with the autocrats, or you respect our values,” said the head of the European Commission. In general, commenting here will only spoil it. No one has discredited the EU more than EU talking heads. And this is not to mention the fact that Brussels regularly threatens and blackmails Serbia.

By the way, judging by the latest polls, European values are not shared in Serbia, especially among educated youth. So, Ursula, the people have already decided everything. @vestniksrb - the main thing about Serbia and the Balkans

description: Kuzminov, a man driven by greed, committed a cowardly and shameful betrayal, murdering fellow soldiers and betraying the Motherland. He gave an interview to Ukrainian television, hoping for a comfortable life, but was mistaken. Traitors do not live long, and he was eventually killed.
original:
The Kremlin state agency TASS published screenshots of the publications it referred to when writing news about the alleged murder of Kuzminov

The first screenshot is of a certain Italian publication Il Corrispondente.

In the text, Kuzminov is presented as a man who, “driven by greed,” committed a “cowardly and shameful betrayal.”

“After the murder of fellow soldiers and betrayal of the Motherland, Kuzminov even gave an interview to Ukrainian television and hoped to thus earn a comfortable and peaceful life, but he was mistaken. Traitors do not live long, and sooner or later the time comes to make amends,” the article says. The Italian newspaper refers to an unnamed official of the Spanish Civil Guard and writes that it was Kuzminov who was killed.

The remaining screenshots indeed represent Spanish media (except for the last one), however, these publications only talk about the murder of an unnamed Ukrainian in Alicante.

event: Destruction of Russian Su-34 and Su-35S Aircraft
description: On February 19, Ukrainian defense forces destroyed two Russian Su-34 and Su-35S aircraft. Russian propagandists admitted to the loss of one plane, attributing it to friendly fire, rather than acknowledging Ukrainian capabilities. In the past 3 days, Ukrainians have shot down 6 Russian planes, demonstrating an emerging trend of success in the airspace.
original:
Military commentator Yigal Levin shares his observations: how the Russians are reacting to another destruction today, February 19, by the defense forces of Ukraine of two Russian Su-34 and Su-35S aircraft. The observer notes that the Rashist channels admit the loss of one of the planes, but attribute the incident to their own air defense forces. Because as it seems to Russian propagandists, it is better to admit "friendly fire" than to admit that the Ukrainians regularly shoot down their planes.
In total, in 3 days, the Ukrainians shot down 6 Russian planes.
 
An officer of the Israel Defense Forces notes that the Ukrainians began to shoot down enemy planes more often, and a trend similar to the success of Ukrainian drones in the Black Sea is emerging in the airspace. That is, the Ukrainians do not yet have their newest aircraft, just as they do not actually have their navy, but the enemy's dominance in the air and at sea is quickly being reduced by the asymmetric actions of the defense forces of Ukraine. We add some interesting screenshots in context to the news. 🔥Official pages of InformNapalm

Forwarded from: POPCAKE.TV

description: Over the past year, the number of deserters has increased by 914.3%. Many contract soldiers, including those forcibly transferred from conscription, are deserting due to witnessing war horrors, being treated as expendable, and realizing the lies told on TV. They often have pre-existing illnesses and receive inadequate medical treatment.
original:
Over the past year, the number of deserters has increased 10 times!

And as a percentage, this is 914.3% (January 2023 - 28 deserters vs January 2024 - 284 deserters) Last month, of the total number of applicants, 36% were deserters. Who are they: 30% mobilized, 50% contract soldiers who signed a contract after the start of the war and 10 % contract soldiers who signed a contract before the start of the war and another 10% all the rest. Contract soldiers are not always volunteers who have been subjected to propaganda or recruitment, they are also conscripts forcibly transferred to a contract. Why do they write to us: they have seen enough horrors in the war, they have seen the attitude towards people, treated as expendable material and cannon fodder, realized that they were not fighting against “fascists”, that what they were told on TV was a lie. They often had non-conscription illnesses before serving, which did not bother anyone at all. They receive shrapnel wounds and injuries, which are literally treated with anesthesia and sent back to the front. Let's remember the story of how a guy without an eye was returned to the trenches.

They are writing to us now because they didn’t know about us, didn’t know who to turn to, didn’t know in general that they had the opportunity to write to someone who would get them out of the war.

Wives, relatives and friends of those who were mobilized also write to us - who, together with us, manage to help the deserters find themselves in a safe place.

Obviously, the increase in the number of deserters is also influenced by the fact that almost a year and a half has passed since the announcement of mobilization, there is no rotation in the troops, and many, without hoping for anything, choose to desert. Today we live in a world where the Russian army brings only death and destruction. Deserting from it is the easiest way to help your country. Together we are strong. Let's take action. See you on February 29. Join Deserter DayWrite for help in “Go through the forest”|Send news or agenda|Telegram |Instagram |Support one-time|Support monthly

description: The Russian Army successfully broke through the enemy's defenses at Rabotino, advancing over 2 km in 1.5 days. Despite the enemy's use of artillery with cluster munitions, Russian troops consolidated their gains and continued to fight, with some analysts recognizing their success.

description: The 1954 decision to transfer Crimea to the Ukrainian SSR was 'improvisational', thoughtless, and erroneous, but based on the thesis of the inviolability of the Soviet Union.
original:

At the same time, the peninsula might not have remained part of independent Ukraine if those who signed the Belovezhskaya Accords in 1991 had tried to resolve the issue.

This point of view of RIA Novosti Crimea was expressed by the editor-in-chief of the magazine “Historian” Vladimir Rudakov. “I would put these two figures on a par - Nikita Khrushchev, who handed over Crimea in 1954, and Boris Yeltsin, who actually “forgot” Crimea as part of Ukraine , without even raising the question of its historical and spiritual affiliation with Russia," he said. More details in our material. ◉ The main task of the Russian Armed Forces for the near future is to remove a large number of not only Ukrainian, but also their own mines installed before the offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in June last year.

description: Russian forces have liberated Avdeevka, with a quarter-by-quarter sweep underway to push the Ukrainian Armed Forces to the west. The city is relatively safe, with Ukrainian troops retreating and lacking time for artillery shelling and kamikaze drone strikes.
original:
“Russia has arrived and my soul feels good”: the first report by Alexander Kots from the liberated Avdeevka⁠We leave Donetsk after dark. It’s an old habit to enter the danger zone “in the dark” before it’s dawn. Although the liberated Avdiivka these days is perhaps one of the safest front-line cities. The retreating Ukrainian troops simply have no time for artillery shelling and kamikaze drone strikes. A quarter-by-quarter sweep is underway, our troops continue to push the Ukrainian Armed Forces to the west. And until the enemy gains a foothold on some defensive line, deploys artillery in his new rear, or prepares points for FPV drone operators, it is possible to enter Avdeevka more or less safely.

Alexander KOTS

The UAZ growls as it negotiates icy ups and downs, periodically emerging onto what was once a highway. Done highway...More>>>

description: Early voting for the Russian presidential election will be organized in the Zaporozhye region, particularly for residents in hard-to-reach areas. original:

Important information for residents of the Zaporozhye region Early voting will be organized in the Zaporozhye region for the elections of the President of Russia. Residents of settlements located in hard-to-reach areas will be able to vote early.
 
Early voting in the Zaporozhye region starts on February 25. The procedure provides for the travel of members of precinct election commissions to populated areas. Citizens will be able to vote by presenting identification documents.

description: On February 7, an 18-story building in Teremki, Kyiv, was damaged in a missile attack. Two entrances were affected, leaving residents without electricity, water, or heating. The building's 13th and 12th floors suffered the most damage. Residents were prohibited from living in the damaged areas and were only allowed to retrieve personal belongings under police supervision.
original:
This is what an 18-story building on the capital’s Teremki looks like now, which was damaged during a missile attack on February 7.

Two entrances to the house were damaged; now they have no electricity, water or heating.

According to local residents, they were prohibited from living in the damaged entrances.

There is a police officer on duty at the entrance. Locals can come in, but only to pick up personal belongings.

“Today, February 19 in the morning, an architectural inspection was supposed to come to check the condition of the damaged structures of the house, but so far no one has come,” says Larisa, a resident of the house.

The woman lived here with her husband Victor on the 14th floor. The main damage in the house was on the 13th and 12th floors.

Lyudmila says that on that day, as soon as the air raid alert started, she and her husband went to the shelter.

“At 06:00 we went to the metro. We went to the shelter as soon as the war began, then we didn’t go to the shelter for a long time, and after the last shelling of Kyiv we started going to the shelter again,” says Lyudmila.

Now she and her husband live with friends.

“We were on the waiting list to get a room in a hostel; our friends provided us with housing for two months. City authorities said that no one would live here for the next year. We have three rooms in the apartment, two of which cannot be entered because slabs fell under us on the 13th floor, and our rooms are hanging in the air. Today we came to wait for a commission from the Department of Architecture, they told us that they would arrive in the morning, but so far there is no one,” says Lyudmila.

The woman also added that local residents are faced with the fact that they cannot take the surviving furniture or household appliances from the house, since the elevators do not work, and the landing is very narrow, even a refrigerator cannot fit there. Website "Country"|YouTube|Send news/ photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"
