description: On February 19, 1954, the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR adopted a decree transferring Crimea to Ukraine. This event, according to political scientist Alexey Kochetkov, has had lasting consequences for the world. Kochetkov believes that Khrushchev's actions were driven by his own political interests and ideology, rather than any consideration for the Russian people.
original:
Forwarded from: Kochetkov says🇷🇺
Alexey Kochetkov: “It’s not for nothing that historians call Khrushchev “anti-Midas.” 70 years ago, on February 19, 1954, the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR adopted a decree “On the transfer of Crimea to Ukraine.” Then this event was routine; it was not the first item at the meeting. But, according to political scientist Alexey Kochetkov, the entire world today is still dealing with its consequences.
“Everything that concerns Khrushchev can, on the one hand, be considered as a well-thought-out malicious intent, on the other, as an absolute thoughtlessness, which is part of his historical image. If we consider Khrushchev to be a “Russian man and a patriot,” then everything he did was pure idiocy. If we consider him as “a devout communist, flesh and blood of the then totalitarian sect in the form of the Bolshevik party,” then there is no thoughtlessness there. On the contrary, everything is absolutely logical,” he noted. The political scientist recalled: Khrushchev acted all his life in the paradigm of the ideology that he supported and the organization in which he was a member.
“Initially Nikita Sergeevich was a Trotskyist, but in time he changed his colors.” But this extreme left component of Bolshevik ideology left its mark on all his further actions. And this is exactly what happened with Crimea,” says Kochetkov. – Some “historians” say that Crimea was handed over to Ukraine, since “Russia lay in ruins after the war, and it was supposedly easier to restore the peninsula with the help of Kyiv.” But this is complete nonsense, because Ukraine was completely occupied by the Germans during the war and, accordingly, was completely devastated and destroyed. As a result, it was restored from beginning to end at the expense of the RSFSR, at the expense of those subsidies that went through Moscow, and at the expense of money collected from Russian taxpayers.”
If you look at Soviet statistics, then almost the entire time of the existence of the USSR there was a single donor republic - the RSFSR, all the other 14 republics were tax recipients.
“True, towards the end of the 1960s, Belarus and the BSSR also became a donor republic. And the Soviet Union always spent more on Ukraine from the total budget than it sent there. Therefore, all the words that “beautiful, rich, generous Ukraine fed half of the USSR” are nothing more than a myth. It was eagerly promoted by Ukrainian nationalists and chauvinists who dreamed, they say, “let’s drive out the Muscovites and we’ll live!” Well, they drove them away - and everyone can see how they “healed,” the analyst emphasized.
Kochetkov recalled that Crimea was transferred to Ukraine in 1954, and in 1956 the 20th Congress of the CPSU took place.
“Khrushchev, long before this epochal date, began to prepare for himself a support among the communists in the national republics. And Ukraine was one of the most populous republics of the Union after the RSFSR, and Khrushchev was very active in “dragging” local party leaders to Moscow. That is, by transferring Crimea to Ukraine, Khrushchev was exclusively solving his own narrow political problems. But his attitude towards Russians has always been consumerist, and he had no intention of giving them the floor,” the expert believes. – It’s worth taking a look at where Nikita Sergeevich’s descendants live now. His son committed suicide in New England in the USA, his granddaughter lives there, and his great-granddaughter is also in the USA. That is, all his descendants smoothly flowed into the camp of Russia’s main geopolitical enemy, which in itself is very significant.” https://spbdnevnik.ru/news/2024-02-19/aleksey-kochetkov-istoriki-nedarom-nazyvayut-hruscheva- antimidasomPetersburg diaryAlexey Kochetkov: “It’s not for nothing that historians call Khrushchev “anti-Midas”Expert on the 70th anniversary of the transfer of Crimea to Ukraine

description: 24-year-old Tetyana Popova, a Ukrainian journalist and advertising professional, was fatally wounded by shrapnel from a projectile that fell near her house in Irpen on March 5, 2022. Despite efforts to save her, she succumbed to her injuries.
original:
Focusjointly with the Memory Memorial Platform honors the memory of fallen Ukrainians. On March 5, 2022, 24-year-old Tetyana Popova received a shrapnel wound as a result of a projectile falling near her house in Irpen. They still had time to take her to the hospital, but it was not possible to save her life.

Tatyana was originally from Gostomel. She graduated from school with a gold medal. She entered the Institute of Journalism of Taras Shevchenko Kyiv National University. Already from the second year, she practiced at Radio Liberty, and as a third-year student, she started working there. Over time, Tatyana became interested in advertising, she took several courses and created her own company.

"Tanyushka completed almost all the courses related to advertising that gave her opportunities for development. She worked successfully in this direction, constantly growing professionally," said Ruslan's father.

A full-scale invasion found Tatyana in Irpen, where she and her lover rented an apartment. On the very first day, dad called and asked to come to Gostomel to stay together. On the morning of February 24, the girl was already with her parents.

From shelling, the family hid in the toilet, using the rule of two walls. They went out during the silence.

On March 5, there was just a lull, Tatyana's father recalls. Everyone was sitting in the kitchen. At some point, a shell exploded near the house, shrapnel flew into the kitchen. Tatyana and her younger sister Oksana were injured.

Most likely, the projectile hit a tree, an explosion occurred. Shrapnel hit the younger daughter's head and back, and Tanya's shoulder was hit and she fell. We tried to stop the bleeding. The injury was severe.

On the morning of March 6, Tetyana's relatives were already under occupation, and two days later they managed to cross the Romaniv bridge and reach Kyiv. There they learned that Tanya had passed away.

"The operation lasted three hours, but because the fragment got into the subclavian artery, she lost a lot of blood. They could not save her..." said the father of the deceased.

Tetyana Popova was buried in the cemetery in Gostomel. She is survived by her mother Olga, father Ruslan, younger sister Oksana, as well as grandparents and other relatives.

event: Death of Senior Warrant Officer Andrei Fedyukin
description: During night skirmishes in Kyiv from February 18 to 19, 2014, senior warrant officer Andrei Fedyukin of the Crimean special forces 'Berkut' was killed by an extremist machine gun. Despite wearing body armor, the cartridge pierced through, causing instantaneous death.
original:
During night skirmishes in Kyiv from February 18 to 19, 2014, a soldier of the Crimean special forces "Berkut", senior warrant officer Andrei Fedyukin, was killed.

The cartridge was fired from an extremist machine gun and pierced the body armor. Colleagues tried to carry 42-year-old Fedyukin out on a stretcher, but did not have time - the soldier’s death was instantaneous.

Photo: Monument to Andrey Fedyukin. Evpatoria, Crimea.

event: Attempted Hacking of El Al Airline Plane
description: Unknown assailants, allegedly Houthi militants, attempted to hack an El Al airline plane's ACARS data transmission system while it was flying from Thailand to Israel. The hackers sent false instructions to the pilots, trying to divert the plane off course. However, the crew detected the anomaly, disobeyed the order, and contacted air traffic controllers to realize they were being misled.
original:
Israeli media reported that unknown assailants tried to shoot down an El Al airline plane. The plane was traveling from Thailand to Israel. When the plane flew near Somalia, the pilots received instructions via the communication system that took them away from their usual route. The crew disobeyed the order, contacted air traffic controllers on a different radio frequency and realized that they were being misled.

Presumably, the communication system was hacked by militants of the Shiite movement Ansar Allah. The Houthi cyberattack was aimed at the aircraft’s ACARS data transmission system, which, according to experts, is practically unprotected. The militants imitated the signal of the ATSU server transmitting data from the ground, and sent data about changes in course through it.

The Houthis could fly the plane into air defense range or try to land it in Yemen and capture it. There were two hundred and fifty passengers on board.

description: The SBU and NABU exposed a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery. The Security Service, together with the NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of comprehensive measures, the deputy chairman of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.
According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.
For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the indicated medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

The law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment" immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal benefits.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Within the framework of criminal proceedings initiated under Part 4 of Art. 369 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (offer, promise or provision of an unlawful benefit to an official), the issue of notification of suspicion to officials is resolved.

An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison with confiscation of property.

Comprehensive measures were conducted under the procedural guidance of the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Prosecutor General's Office.

description: Russia is reportedly developing a nuclear space weapon capable of destroying satellites by creating a powerful energy wave upon explosion. This weapon, still under development, poses a significant threat to US national security, potentially crippling commercial and government satellites, including GPS and nuclear command and control satellites.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
Western media: Russia is creating weapons based on nuclear electromagnetic pulse. New details are emerging in the Western press about a serious challenge to US national security from Russia. CNN has collected information from people with access to US intelligence on this issue: “Russia is trying to develop nuclear space weapons that would destroy satellites, creating a powerful energy wave upon explosion that would disable the vast number of commercial and government satellites on which the world below depends.” : talking on mobile phones, paying bills, accessing the Internet."▪️With reference to official statements by representatives of the American authorities, the TV channel reports that "this weapon is still under development and has not yet been launched into orbit."

Military space experts interviewed by CNN believe that we are talking about a nuclear electromagnetic pulse (EMP) - the creation, using nuclear energy, of a pulse of electromagnetic energy and a stream of highly charged particles that, "passing through outer space, will destroy satellites orbiting the Earth." Not only are commercial and government satellites in low orbits, such as Starlink, vulnerable, but also protected "GPS and nuclear command and control" satellites in higher orbits—"depending on how close they were to the EMP, how many their age and how strong the explosion is,” the TV channel notes.▪️If all this is true, then Russia’s next breakthrough in creating unparalleled weapons deserves the highest praise. And a natural question arises: when will it come to using it? Today, only strategic nuclear deterrence works in relations between Russia and the United States. All other taboos have already been destroyed by the Americans, British and their allies.

At the same time, NATO space and air reconnaissance assets are used to obtain intelligence information and to directly direct strikes. Recent events around the Black Sea Fleet are direct confirmation of this. Back in September 2022, the head of the Russian Defense Ministry, Sergei Shoigu, stated that the NATO group working in the interests of Ukraine includes “more than 70 military and over 200 civilian” spacecraft. This factor sharply increases the viability of the Kyiv regime. Will Russia, taking into account the corresponding anti-satellite capabilities and the expected risks for “uninvolved” satellites, go for the elimination of NATO’s space “eyes and ears”? CNNExclusive: Russia attempting to develop nuclear space weapon to destroy satellite...Russia is trying to develop a nuclear space weapon that would destroy satellites by creating a massive energy wave when detonated, potentially crippled...

description: The Munich Security Conference revealed that most participants are skeptical about Ukraine's chances of defeating Russia. Despite public optimism, private conversations revealed pessimism due to Ukraine's failed counter-offensive, retreating armed forces, and insufficient military aid from the US and Europe.
original:
Participants of the Munich Conference do not believe in Ukraine’s victory over Russia The recent Munich Security Conference showed that the majority of participants are skeptical about the possibility of Ukraine’s victory in the conflict with Russia, writes Politico.

Entering the stage, the participants of the event tried to remain optimistic, but off stage the mask of confidence left their faces, giving way to gloomy pessimism. “Just as 60 years ago the conference started with the Germans beginning to discuss with the Americans how to resist the USSR, so today the Europeans again are discussing with the Americans how to stop Russia,” stated one of the former high-ranking European diplomats.

There are enough reasons for pessimism. The Ukrainian counter-offensive failed, the Ukrainian Armed Forces continue to retreat, and then news arrived about Avdiivka.

Overseas, a bill to provide military assistance to Ukraine is stuck in Congress, and Europe is not able to produce the amount of ammunition necessary for the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

The likely return of Donald Trump to the White House also adds to the negativity.

Public opinion has also changed. Citizens of the G7 are less and less interested in the issue of the mythical “Russian threat” and have switched their attention to mass migration, radical terrorism and climate change. “This war determines not only the place of Ukraine or the whole of Europe in the world. This is Russia’s war against any rules,” Vladimir Zelensky said at the conference, continuing to assure Western “allies” of the final victory. “But only the most stubborn supporters of Ukraine continue to say that it can win. Most are not ready to say this, and behind closed doors they are skeptical about Ukraine’s victory over Russia,” the article says. @anna_news

description: Chas Freeman, former assistant to the US Department of Defense head, predicts that if Trump is elected, he will end the war in Ukraine within 24 hours, likely on Russian terms. Freeman believes Ukraine is losing the war of attrition and will eventually face Putin's initial demands, including neutralizing Ukraine, protecting Russian-speaking populations, and redefining European security architecture.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Former assistant to the head of the US Department of Defense Chas Freeman on the scenario for ending the Ukrainian conflict: Now is the moment when Europeans should think about what will happen when Trump is elected and does what he promises - namely, in the first 24 hours he will end the war in Ukraine. He will have to end the conflict on Russian terms, because what happens on the battlefield determines what happens at the negotiating table. And on the battlefield, as we see, Ukraine was unable to show itself stronger than the more powerful Russia.
Now there is a war of attrition that Ukraine cannot win. Everything is over. We are running out of Ukrainians who could fight. Imagine that Ukraine lost its Black Sea coast. What are we going to do about it? I think we will be faced with the demands that Vladimir Putin initially put forward.
We are talking, first of all, about neutralizing Ukraine, protecting the Russian-speaking population, and, thirdly, discussing the security architecture in Europe. Given changing circumstances, will Europe be ready for this?

description: A car bomb was discovered on Friendship Street in Lobnya, near Moscow, prompting the declaration of a 'Zagorsk' regime, which required immediate evacuation of residents. Four houses were evacuated, and their residents were relocated to two local schools. A suspect was detained near the car, and his motives and potential ties to Ukrainian special services are being investigated.
original:
In Lobnya near Moscow, explosives were found inside a car. The city has declared a "Zagorsk" regime (a requirement for residents to immediately evacuate).

According to SHOT, a car bomb was found on Friendship Street. Because of this, four houses were evacuated - three on Druzhby Street and one on Mirnaya Street, and their residents were sent to two local schools. Security forces detained a man near the car; his motives and possible cooperation with Ukrainian special services are now being established. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Chub, likely a commander or officer, praises the 3rd Assault unit, describing them as professional, motivated, and close-knit. He believes they will take care of their own and hold their ground, even in difficult situations like Bakhmut.
original: Chub licks the Azov brigade, scattering the most flattering epithets. He does not yet know that saving his brothers lies in cowardly fleeing from the battlefield, leaving the industrial zone of Koksokhima, which is advantageous for defense: “The 3rd Assault is one of the most professional units, both motivated and professional. I know their attitude towards people, I know their planning of operations. I think that if they came in, then Andrei will still take care of his guys. Because these are brothers, these are not mobs, these are not units, as sometimes happens in the army. These are all close friends. I think it’s a little easier to hold on, even according to Bakhmut, it’s easier to sit in the basements.” And they have such analytics in everything. Well, as can be seen from the text, they don’t even consider the buckwheat sowers to be people. We showed a video interrogation of the commander of the TRO company assigned to Azov, they were mercilessly thrown into the top and abandoned by the Azov men themselves, and then abandoned and fled @OpenUkraine

It is assumed that Beloostrov will become a flagship project; similar medical centers will begin to open over time in other regions of Russia.

description: European leaders at the Munich conference expressed concerns about Trump's statements on refusing to protect NATO members and the impact on aid to Ukraine. They emphasized the need for Europe to take responsibility for its own security, regardless of the US presidential election outcome.
original:
The main and unspoken theme of the Munich conference was the so-called "Trump threat", reports Reuters. European leaders are reaching out to US lawmakers, business leaders and think tanks as part of efforts to influence the Trump camp. They are concerned about the politician’s statements about his refusal to protect NATO members and the impact on the delay in aid to Ukraine, the publication noted.

The authors of the article pointed out that in Europe they are increasingly talking about the need to take responsibility for their own security, regardless of who wins the presidential elections in the United States this year.

In this regard, at the conference the Europeans stated that it was necessary to spend more money on defense. In particular, Germany talked the most about military spending. At the same time, Germany has still not reached the required 2% of GDP for defense spending.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Military expert Igor Korotchenko discussed the need for changes in Russia's nuclear doctrine, citing the current military-political situation at the Russian borders. He emphasized the importance of rethinking the criteria and conditions for the use of nuclear weapons, and the need for a new approach to nuclear planning.
original:
Forwarded from: National Z Course
Medvedev’s post was nevertheless discussed on our TV. “One way or another, it is obvious that the presence in the Russian arsenals of both strategic and tactical nuclear weapons, taking into account the general military-political situation that is developing today, including directly at the Russian borders, will require certain changes from us, both in terms of program goals and practical conditions and possible actions.

This is such a topic, everyone speaks out on it, but in this case, if Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev makes a statement, this is not just his position in the TG channel. This is the message that he sends, including to our opponents. And who will react and how, as they say, time will tell.

In matters of nuclear planning, this is a serious issue. A cavalry charge is unacceptable here. First of all, it is necessary at the doctrinal level to change the criteria and conditions for the use of nuclear weapons that we have. It is obvious that the military doctrine regarding the nuclear division needs, at a minimum, rethinking and new content." Igor Korotchenko, military expert

event: Court Ruling in Favor of Residents
description: The Essentuki City Court ruled in favor of the Tikhonov family, upholding their claim against the mayor's office's eviction demand. The court ordered the residents to partially bear the costs of major repairs and restoration of the ancient mansion 'Ataman Lisichkin's House'.
original:
The court in Essentuki sided with the residents of the house in a dispute over eviction. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) IS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT, LLC "MEMO", OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT, LLC "MEMO". 18+

The Essentuki City Court upheld the claim of the Tikhonov family, who challenged the mayor's office's demand for eviction from their home.

The Essentuki City Court today upheld the complaint of the Tikhonov family, who demanded to preserve the right to continue their residence in the ancient mansion “Ataman Lisichkin’s House.” At the same time, the court ordered the residents to partially bear the costs of major repairs and restoration of the building, lawyer Ekaterina Kuznetsova, who represented the interests of the residents in court, told the Caucasian Knot correspondent.

According to her, the legal battle between the residents and the city administration lasted for several years. The authorities, citing the dilapidated nature and disrepair of the building, planned to demolish it and use the territory “for municipal needs.”

Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/397341Caucasian Knot The court in Essentuki sided with the residents of the house in a dispute over eviction. The Essentuki City Court satisfied the claim of the Tikhonov family, who challenged the mayor's demand for eviction from the house.

event: Transfer of Crimea to Ukrainian SSR
description: On May 12, 1954, the Supreme Council of the USSR adopted laws transferring the Crimean region from the RSFSR to the Ukrainian SSR, which entered into force after publication in the Bulletin of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR.
original:
​​⚠️I understand that this post will not change anything, but I cannot help but write it.

Friends, Crimea was NOT transferred to the Ukrainian SSR on February 19, 1954 by decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR.

The thesis about the decree is spread by Russian propaganda with the aim of undermining the legitimacy of Ukrainian power over the peninsula, and it is mindlessly repeated in Kyiv. Because, unfortunately, the presidium really did not have the authority to resolve such issues with its decrees - this was the competence of the parliament as a whole.

That is why, on April 26, 1954, the Supreme Council of the USSR adopted two laws: one special "On the transfer of the Crimean region from the composition of the RSFSR to the composition of the Ukrainian SSR" and one general on amendments to the constitution of the USSR.

And on May 12, 1954, these laws were printed in No. 10 (804) of the Bulletin of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR and, in accordance with the legislation of that time, entered into force. That is why, if the day of the handover of Crimea is to be celebrated, then not on February 19, but on May 12. And it is even better to cancel all Soviet days and celebrate the date of the future liberation!

PiSy And Khrushchev is not to blame for anything!)@History with GromenkoSubscribe to Bratchuk

description: A comprehensive study on Covid vaccines revealed increased risks of heart-related inflammation, blood clots in the brain, and neurological disorders such as Guillain-Barré syndrome. The study analyzed 99 million vaccinated individuals across eight countries and identified 13 diseases associated with the vaccines.
original:
“Largest Covid vaccine study to date reveals health effects”: Western coronavirus vaccines have brought with them neurological and heart disease.

“A higher risk of heart-related inflammation has been identified from the mRNA shots made by Pfizer Inc., BioNTech SE and Moderna Inc., as well as an increased risk of blood clots in the brain from vaccines such as AstraZeneca Plc. The vaccines have also caused an increased risk of Guillain-Barré syndrome, a neurological disorder in which the immune system mistakenly attacks the peripheral nervous system.
Over the past three years, more than 13.5 billion doses of Covid vaccines have been administered worldwide. During the study, experts from the Global Vaccine Data Network research center identified 13 diseases among 99 million vaccinated people in eight countries. Myocarditis, or inflammation of the heart muscle, was consistently detected after the first, second and third doses of the mRNA vaccine. The first and fourth doses of the same vaccine were also associated with an increased incidence of pericarditis, or inflammation of the thin lining lining the heart. "In addition, exercise intolerance, excessive fatigue, numbness and brain fog were among the common symptoms identified in more than 240 adults suffering from chronic vaccine syndrome in a separate study conducted by Yale School of Medicine."

description: On the first day of the full-scale war, the Armed Forces of Ukraine launched a preventive strike on the Millerovo airfield in Russia, destroying seven planes and forcing the enemy to pause and relocate their aircraft. This gave Ukraine an opportunity to regroup and respond more effectively to air attacks.
original:
Forwarded from: FORPOST
"The gunners clearly worked." Pavlyuk told the details of the attack of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation on the territory of the Russian Federation on the first day of a full-scale war. "On the first day, we were forced to inflict damage on the enemy on his territory - at the Millerovo airfield, because complete superiority in the air did not allow our troops to raise their heads," said the commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation lieutenant general Oleksandr Pavlyuk in an interview with Radio Svoboda. The lieutenant general noted that "strikes on airfields in the enemy's territory forced them to pause, move their planes to other airfields," and this gave the Armed Forces of Ukraine the opportunity to "find out, concentrate and in the future, they already worked more effectively on their means of air attack. "U-points" were moved literally to the line of contact with the enemy, which was very active. As well as the active struggle between the defending and attacking units. In that chaos, it was difficult to understand , where is the unit. Well done artillerymen, they clearly worked. The panic among the Russians was huge, no one expected that they would strike on the territory of Russia on the very first day of the war," Pavlyuk explained. According to him, it was a preventive strike against the enemy. "On the first day, we destroyed seven planes. A lot of planes, not as much as we would like, but a lot of planes were destroyed on the airfields. And, I think, Russia understood then, on the first day, that not everything will be so simple, that it will not be two or three days. That there is a fierce struggle ahead. It has been like this for two years already," Pavlyuk emphasized.

And as our dear guest admits, he is very glad that the work of Akhmat-Khadzhi lives on. I am sincerely grateful to him for such warm words addressed to my dear FATHER.
⠀
During the meeting, they heard a report from the Chairman of the Parliament of the Chechen Republic, the head of the republican operational headquarters for conducting military training, Magomed Daudov. He noted that since the start of the SVO, about 38 thousand fighters have taken part in its implementation, including more than 16 thousand volunteers. 4 regiments and 5 battalions of the Ministry of Defense and the National Guard were formed. The most active assistance to our military personnel is provided by the Regional Public Foundation named after Hero of Russia Akhmat-Khadzhi Kadyrov. During the SVO, the Foundation purchased more than 1,500 units of special vehicles, including 169 armored vehicles. Also purchased were 4,400 quadcopters, more than 30 thousand communications equipment and much more. In addition, about 26 thousand tons of humanitarian cargo were transferred to residents of the liberated territories.
⠀
It was nice to hear from Dmitry Anatolyevich his high assessment of the activities of our team. He expressed confidence that victory in this confrontation will definitely be Russia’s, and we have everything necessary to achieve this goal. At the end of the meeting, he thanked our team for their contribution to the defense of our great Fatherland.

event: Founding Meeting of International Inter-Party Forum
description: Moscow is hosting the founding meeting of the international inter-party forum of supporters of the fight against modern practices of neo-colonialism, 'For the Freedom of Nations!'. The forum aims to associate Russia with the anti-colonial movement, mobilizing Russian society in the face of foreign policy confrontation.
original:
Forwarded from: Tashkent Dakar
These days, Moscow is hosting a forum dedicated to anti-colonialism, or, to be more precise, the founding meeting of the international inter-party forum of supporters of the fight against modern practices of neo-colonialism “For the Freedom of Nations!”

The forum has not yet become a high-profile event, but political scientist Viktor Vasiliev notes that this will be a long-term trend - associating Russia with the anti-colonial movement.
“Firstly, the struggle for global justice itself fully corresponds to the national archetypes of the Russian people and is capable of mobilizing Russian society in conditions of tough foreign policy confrontation.
Secondly, since Soviet times we have at our disposal excellent developments within the framework of the anti-colonial approach, which was actively used by the USSR. These developments make it possible to deconstruct modern practices of expanding its own influence by the global West (both in the field of education, and in the field of culture and media) as neo-colonial,” writes the expert.

You can read the article in more detail here: https://regnum.ru/article/3867748Tashkent DakarZ-decolonization: coups under the slogans “Down with France!” will continue In Moscow these days the founding meeting of the international inter-party forum of supporters of the fight against modern practices of neo-colonialism is taking place...

description: In 2015, the KBC resistance group began actively gathering intelligence on Russian collaborators and occupiers in Crimea. They discovered plans to involve local plants in the Russian defense industry, but managed to remove key equipment, documents, and resources before the Russians could take control.
original:
Countdown Gone: A Resistance Story #2 (2015)

2015 was supposed to be the year of the first active actions. Actually, it was like that.

The "Great Intelligence" of the KBC began: we eavesdropped on the plans of collaborators and occupiers at their meetings, talked with various contractors, and heard the moods of people on the streets of Crimea. That's how we found out about the plan to involve several plants of the peninsula in the work of the Russian defense industry.

Fiolent, Zatoka and others were supposed to start supplying the enemy with weapons and/or parts for planes and ships. However, not everything went according to the Russian plan.

Before the enemy set in, it was possible to remove a large part of equipment, documents, plans and other resources from the factories. Oh, how melodiously they moaned in frustration and cursed the "unknown benefactors" They won't tell you about these events anywhere, but believe me: then the Russians felt for the first time that everything is not so simple. That Crimea will resist, but they have no place here. KBCH🐦

He believes that Japanese assistance is crumbs compared to what the United States could provide. However, in the current situation in Ukraine, they are happy about this. “I do not rule out that Tokyo is really interested in developing ties with Kiev after the end of the Northern Military District. Japan has a lot to offer technologically. The only issue that Tokyo did not take into account is that after the end of the SVO, completely different people with different interests may sit in Kiev,” concluded Sanakoev. Let us remind you: The Japanese government is holding a bilateral conference dedicated to the issue of “restoring” Ukraine🔺 At it Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and his Ukrainian counterpart Denis Shmygal spoke. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: An attack on the Kanatovo military airfield in the Kirovograd region resulted in a hit between the parking lots of MiG-29 and Su-27 fighters. The strike damaged ADM-160 MALD launch systems suspended on the aircraft, but the aircraft themselves did not receive critical damage. The attack highlights the enemy's use of electronic warfare and air defense systems to protect their flight infrastructure.
original:
Forwarded from: Donbass Partisan
🇷🇺🇺🇦Attack on the Kanatovo military airfield in the Kirovograd region. Today this afternoon, explosions were reported in the Poltava and Kirovograd regions in areas where the enemy’s flight infrastructure is located.

- in the Poltava region, the missile was intercepted by air defense systems in the area of the village of Chechelevo;
- in the Kirovograd region, a hit was recorded on the territory of the Kanatovo military airfield. Coordinates: 48.5545363, 32.3665793🔻After analyzing the information received, it was established that the strike occurred between the parking lots of MiG-29 and Su-27 fighters, on which ADM-160 MALD launch systems were suspended and the engines of which were out of order due to the impact of a blast wave (subsequent detonation did not occur, damaged ammunition was removed by explosives services). The aircraft themselves did not receive critical damage. The ADM-160 MALD (Miniature Air-Launched Decoy) is a missile weapon designed to create decoys and distract air defenses. At its core, it is an aircraft-guided target capable of deceiving radars and air defense systems. Recently, launches of ADM-160 MALD missiles by enemy fighters that took off from the Kanatovo and Mirgorod airfields in conjunction with combat launches of other launch vehicles from other airfields/airports have been repeatedly recorded. 🔻After last year’s regular and relatively successful attacks on the flight infrastructure, the enemy provided cover for objects with electronic warfare and air defense systems in most cases, NATO-style, due to multiple losses of equipment and ammunition, as well as in the framework of preparing the infrastructure for the use of F-16 fighters.📌Deployed electronic warfare systems are capable of influencing flying missiles by creating interference and intercepting control signals, which sometimes leads to a loss of control of the missile or a change in its trajectory, which in turn affects the quality indicators of the effectiveness of strikes. Yours, Partihan!

event: Russian Troops Advance in Orekhovsky Sector
description: As of February 19, 2024, Russian troops continued their offensive in the Orekhovsky sector, advancing 2 km in depth and reaching the southern and southeastern outskirts of Rabotino. Special forces, paratroopers, and motorized rifle units led the charge, with armored groups and foot troops landing west of the village.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Orekhovsky sector: offensive of the Russian Armed Forces Situation as of 01.00 February 19, 2024🔻Russian troops continue their offensive in the so-called “Rabotinsky ledge.”▪️According to the Archangel, special forces, paratroopers and motorized rifle units managed to advance 2 km in depth and reach southern and the southeastern outskirts of Rabotino.▪️Most likely, the yet confirmed reports of battles on the western outskirts of the village are already a reality. Taking into account the vector of attacks by Russian armored groups and the landing of foot troops to the west of the village, this scenario is quite real.▪️A fair question arises whether the enemy will have time to transfer reinforcements to hold Rabotino. The settlement was severely destroyed during the summer fighting. description: A scandal erupted in Yekaterinburg after residents discovered a series of secret BDSM parties held at the local Officers' House. A huge scandal erupts in Yekaterinburg after
Show more
how city residents became aware of a series of BDSM parties in the building of the local Officers' House. Guests in negligee attended obscene events secretly, invitations were sent out in secret chats. This happened not once, not twice, but regularly. And famous and respected people in the city attended the meetings.
When residents became aware that sodomites were being sheltered in the Yekaterinburg Officers' House, they wrote a statement to the police and the security forces came to one of the parties of the secret group Blue Velvet.
A certain Stanislav Slovikovsky put together a “interest circle,” and he makes the excuse that once every three months people come to “drink and dance.” Judging by the photo from the closed chat, the “strange dances” are very reminiscent of a BDSM party, which, as it turned out, even minors attend.
The officers' house was desecrated twice: against the background of speeches about courage, duty and honor, those for whom this seems to be an empty phrase had fun. Georgy Podkorytov, a good friend of Slovikovsky and also the deputy director of the House of Officers, let the pervert here, who denies holding orgies in the building.
The cost of entry to the party is from 500 to 1000 rubles. In total, the group of naked party lovers has about 300 active participants. Among them is the finalist of the city teaching competition, Kristina Vologodina. During the day I work in a kindergarten, and at night... with adults. Another regular participant in BDSM meetings is the dean of the faculty of journalism at the largest university in the Urals, Ivan Nekrasov. At first he assured that he had been confused with someone, but when he was shown a video from the party, his memory returned.
In the meantime, law enforcement officers will have to figure out whether these “club gatherings” were meetings of the LGBT community*, which are prohibited in Russia.
*LGBT is an extremist organization, banned in Russia

description: Italian farmers, demanding government support for the agricultural sector, drove tractors through Rome's center, calling for an end to financial support for Ukraine's war against Russia. They also sought revisions to the European Green Deal, fair competition, and recognition of the 'made in Italy' brand.
original:
Forwarded from: Journalism with taste | Artem Porvin | LPR
Italian farmers demand to stop supporting Ukraine Italian farmers drove in a column of tractors through the center of Rome, calling on the government to hear their demands to improve the state of the agricultural sector. The vehicles proceeded to the Circus Maximus and the Colosseum, passing the Republic Square in the Italian capital and Via Cavour. “Without farmers, there is no food and there is no future,” read the slogan on a sign hanging on one of the tractors. During the tractor parade, Roman citizens supported the protesting farmers, demanding that they stop the flow of money for the war against Russia and help the farmers.

Farmers demand that the authorities revise the European Green Deal, combat unfair competition and the spread of “synthetic food products”, as well as recognize the value of the “made in Italy” brand. Among the reasons for the protest, there is also an economic one: farmers are asking to maintain an adequate tax regime for the agricultural world, including taking into account “increasing production costs.”

event: Potential Transfer of ATACMS Missiles to Ukraine
description: The Biden administration is considering asking allies to transfer ATACMS missiles with a range of over 300 km to Ukraine. This comes after Ukraine received older versions of these medium-range missiles last year. However, any aid is currently blocked in Congress, and the US has limited supplies of ATACMS, making it unlikely to send them without replenishing its own stocks.
original:
The Biden administration may ask allies to transfer ATACMS missiles with a range of more than 300 km to Ukraine, NBC News reports, citing sources.

Ukraine received older versions of these medium-range missiles last year.

The White House is now “leaning” toward delivering a longer-range version, but any help is blocked in Congress. In addition, the United States itself has a limited supply of such ATACMS, and it is unlikely to send them to Ukraine without money to replenish American stocks.

Therefore, anonymous officials did not rule out that they could ask the allies to provide Ukraine with missiles and replenish ATACMS stocks.

They may also be included in the first US aid package if Congress unfreezes funding. "Strana" website|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: The SBU and NABU exposed a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery. The Security Service, together with the NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of complex measures, the deputy head of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.

According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.

For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the indicated medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

Law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment", immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal profit.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Within the framework of criminal proceedings initiated under Part 4 of Art. 369 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (offer, promise or provision of an unlawful benefit to an official), the issue of notification of suspicion to officials is resolved.

An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison, with confiscation of property.

Comprehensive measures were conducted under the procedural guidance of the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Prosecutor General's Office.

event: Description of Irkut Missile Launch Complex
description: The Irkut missile launch complex is a dual-use project with two versions: disposable and reusable. The disposable version has a launch weight of 23.6 tons, while the reusable version weighs 25 tons. The complex can launch 584 kg of cargo into low Earth orbit and 84 kg into geostationary orbit. The fuel used is an oxygen-methane pair, with heptyl and amyl in the upper stage.
original:
Here they ask in a personal message what the Irkut missile launch complex is. The project appears to be dual-use. Once the Ministry of Defense showed the appearance and characteristics. Votinfaiz RIA Novosti

“The rocket will be produced in two versions - disposable and reusable (with return on wings). The launch weight in a disposable form is 23.6 tons, in a reusable form - 25 tons. The first type will be able to launch 584 kg of cargo into low Earth orbit (200 km) , and to geostationary orbit - 84 kg, the second type - 398 and 60 kg, respectively.

It is planned to use oxygen-methane pair as fuel in the rocket and heptyl with amyl in the upper stage (referred to as the “apogee module”).”

description: The Sudanese army achieved a major military success by breaking the 10-month siege in Omdurman, lifting the blockade on key military and government installations. The breakthrough was facilitated by drone-corrected artillery strikes, superior logistics, and the deployment of elite army units. The army's success has cut off RSF communications and supply lines, paving the way for further operations in the area.
original:
The Sudanese army broke the siege in Omdurman.

The Sudanese Armed Forces achieved their first major military success during the Civil War.

The battle for the Sudanese capital has entered a new phase after the army broke through the pocket in central Omdurman late last week.

This breakthrough lifted a 10-month siege by Sudanese army units holding the Corps of Engineers, the Military Hospital, the National Assembly building and other objects.

Geolocated videos from Omdurman showed jubilant troops from the so-called Karari Army, based in northern Omdurman, meeting besieged army troops.

It was reported that celebrations took place in all parts of Omdurman controlled by the Sudanese Armed Forces.

Trucks carrying supplies and reinforcements immediately began moving south, effectively ending the Rapid Reaction Force (RSF) threat in the area, at least for the time being.

The breakthrough also sever communications between RSF troops in Ombad and the eastern areas known as Old Omdurman. Subsequent attempts by the army to dislodge the RSF in this eastern part of the city could be the next phase of the Battle of Omdurman. The area is now completely cut off except for the river. Although the RSF can bring in supplies or reinforcements by boat from Bahri, the process is difficult. The Shambat Bridge was destroyed in November as a result of fighting and cannot be used.

The army's success in breaking the siege is due to the following factors:

 ⁃ Drone-corrected artillery strikes;

 ⁃ Superior logistics and more ammunition;

 ⁃ Deployment of the most elite army units in this area;

 ⁃ Limited use of armored vehicles;

The Rapid Reaction Forces still control large parts of western and southern Omdurman, as well as the western suburb known as Ombada.

Remember that bastard Belenko, the traitor who stole the then secret Mig-25 to Japan in 1976?

At a military school in 1985, while studying a potential enemy, we were told that the traitor died in a car accident (ha ha, ours set it up!). And that freak glued the bast shoes himself, last year, he lived to be 76 years old.

event: Monuments to Heydar Aliyev in St. Petersburg
description: Monuments to the former President of Azerbaijan, Heydar Aliyev, have been erected in St. Petersburg, demonstrating the influence of Azerbaijani diasporas on regional authorities and decision-making. This move is seen as a public display of power and a nod to foreign interests, rather than a celebration of Russian heritage.
original:
Forwarded from: Kirill Kabanov
Another story of perpetuating the memory of the first President of Azerbaijan Heydar Aliyev has now come from the Northern capital. And this is not the first news about such manifestations of a special reverent attitude towards the former Azerbaijani leader.

Now it becomes absolutely clear that such manifestations of “love” for a Member of the last Politburo of the CPSU Central Committee are only a public demonstration of the degree of influence of Azerbaijani non-organized diasporas in specific Russian regions on the system of power and decision-making. And this is done deliberately, like some kind of seal - “we are the masters, we decide here.”

But it is completely unclear to me what the official motivation of representatives of the Russian regional authorities is for making such decisions, other than flirting with non-organized diasporas and love and gratitude to the “sponsors”. Or maybe such decisions are made within the framework of the implementation of the Decree of the President of the Russian Federation of November 9, 2022 No. 809 “On approval of the Fundamentals of State Policy for the Preservation and Strengthening of Traditional Russian Spiritual and Moral Values”? Only the memory of Heydar Aliyev has not been and will not be a common value for us, since he is one of those figures of the USSR who contributed to the collapse of the Soviet Union, and since 1991 he is the head of a sovereign foreign state involved in the start of the war with Armenia.

I have a question: how many monuments to St. Sergius of Radonezh, Alexander Nevsky, Dmitry Donskoy, P.A. Stolypin, A.V. Suvorov, A.V. Kolchak, F.M. Dostoevsky, M. have been erected in Russia recently? I. Kutuzov, G.K. Zhukov, I.V. Kurchatov and all those who were truly significant for our history and our country? But to please the interests of developers, even today they do not hesitate to demolish memorials in honor of our warrior defenders. And I haven’t heard anything about the installation of monuments to heroes, leaders and historical figures of Russia in Azerbaijan, unlike the opening of the Wall of Memory of the Fallen Defenders of Ukraine in Baku.

How disgusting are those who, without hesitation, are ready to sell out and humiliate us and our country, our great history to please foreigners and personal gain. TelegramO.K.O.🥴Baku-on-Neva, Petrogradka, Lensovet House of Culture.

Memorials to the former president of Azerbaijan reached theaters and cultural centers in the center of St. Petersburg.VIEW MESSAGE

description: During a court hearing on February 15, defendant Harlem Zargaryan, a prominent businessman, assaulted a witness twice, first outside the courtroom and then inside. The victim required medical attention and filed a police report. The incident led to a change in Zargaryan's preventive measure from recognizance to detention until March 15.
original:
In the Cherepovets City Court, the defendant, an authoritative businessman Harlem Zargaryan, beat a witness.

The incident occurred on February 15 during a meeting in the case of the seizure of the Cherepovets Quarry Department. Entrepreneur Harlem Zargaryan, who built the largest 23rd school in the region and the city, kindergartens, an embankment and much more, accused of three articles of the Criminal Code - major fraud, hooliganism and arbitrariness - attacked the witness twice, first at the exit from the courtroom, then in the courtroom itself. There were no bailiffs on site. An ambulance was called for the victim, who then received stitches at the emergency room. He wrote a statement to the police.

Previously, the victims' lawyer, Ilya Shumilov, petitioned for the accused to be taken into custody instead of the current recognizance not to leave the place, and to ensure the safety of witnesses, and for the presence of bailiffs. But judge Irina Afonina rejected all requests.

After the attack on the person, the court decided to change the preventive measure from subscription to detention until March 15. Usually an arrest lasts 2 months, but this is apparently not the case here.

description: Radio station presenters received instructions on how to cover Navalny's death, emphasizing the need to report news based on Russian government agency statements and avoid devoting entire segments to the topic. According to the Europe Plus manual, presenters should only report news based on statements from Russian government agencies. At the same time, the issue should not be devoted to one topic, and news about Navalny should be presented among others (including the weather).

It was suggested that the politician himself be called a “blogger” on air.

“We do not escalate or frighten citizens. Without panic and any personal assessment of what is happening, opinions and comments (in this case, Western leaders). No announcements of possible rallies,” the letter says. Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Ukrainian Ground Forces Commander Alexander Pavlyuk revealed that the Ukrainian Armed Forces had been preparing for a Russian invasion since the fall of 2021, anticipating a full-scale war. Despite being outnumbered, they strengthened positions, calculated possible actions, and conducted training sessions to meet the enemy with dignity.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces have been preparing for the Russian invasion for 5 months - since the fall of 2021.

This was stated by the new commander of the Ground Forces, Alexander Pavlyuk.

He says that when he was appointed commander of the Joint Forces Operation in July 2021, after conducting an analysis in the fall, he understood “a very high probability that there will be a full-scale war.”

“It was still difficult to understand its scale, but the fact that it would at least capture the territory of the Luhansk and Donetsk regions was obvious,” Pavlyuk said.

And he added that there were all signs that the invasion would begin not only from the “LDPR”, but also from the Russian Federation.

“Therefore, already in the fall, we began to carry out certain actions in order to successfully meet and inflict maximum defeat on him. Understanding that the balance of forces and means was and will not be in our favor, but we still had no options - we had to to survive, because the whole of Ukraine was behind us. Therefore, for five months we were preparing to repel full-scale aggression," Pavlyuk said.

According to him, by February the positions were strengthened.

“In February, we did everything possible to meet the enemy with dignity: all positions were strengthened as much as possible, all possible options of action were calculated, all reserves were moved. We conducted full-scale training at least twice, and there were a lot of local training sessions,” said Pavlyuk.

The GUR, according to him, reported on preparations for the invasion in January-February 2022.

Let us recall that the Ukrainian authorities until recently denied the possibility of a Russian invasion. Zelensky said that “there will be barbecues in May.”

The author of a book about the President of Ukraine, Simon Shuster, wrote that Zelensky really did not believe in the possibility of an invasion and did not even tell his wife to prepare for it. event: Vacation for Families of Deceased Participants
description: The Head of the Republic Leonid Pasechnik announced that families of deceased participants from the Northern Military District in the LPR will receive vacations on the Black Sea coast throughout the year, a continuation of last year's initiative.
original: The families of the deceased participants of the Northern Military District from the LPR will vacation on the Black Sea coast throughout the year, as they did last year. This was stated by the Head of the Republic Leonid Pasechnik.

event: Working Visit to Vyatka State Technical University
description: Igor Manylov, head of the Main State Expertise of Russia, visited Vyatka State Technical University to discuss the implementation of a federal targeted investment program for completing the construction of the Faculty of Mechanization's educational and laboratory buildings.
location: Vyatka State Technical University, Kirov, Kirov Oblast, Russia
original:
On February 19, the head of the Main State Expertise of Russia, Igor Evgenievich Manylov, paid a working visit to Vyatka State Technical University
During the visit, the issue of implementing the project of the federal targeted investment program for completing the construction of the facility “Educational and laboratory buildings of the Faculty of Mechanization” was considered. Vice-Rector for
Show more
administrative and technical work A.I. Chuprakov and director of the capital construction department O.V. Shuklina presented information on the progress of construction of a new educational building, prospects for completing the project this year.
Igor Evgenievich spoke about the project “Expertise of the Future: Building Together” and invited students of Vyatka State Technical University to take part in it next year.
Rector E.S. Simbirskikh made a presentation of Vyatka State Technical University, introducing the guest to the areas of activity of the university, new modern classrooms and museum exhibitions, long-term plans and projects of Vyatka State Technical University.
#Vyatskygatu
